title.rendered: Are You a Garbage Picker? by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning

“Now Samuel was dead, and all Israel had mourned for him and buried him in his own town of Ramah. Saul had expelled the mediums and spiritists from the land” 1 Sam 28:3

In this passage Prophet Samuel, who represented God’s voice, was dead. Saul had no communication with God because of his disobedience which will be seen shortly. It was similar to a soldier losing radio contact with their commanding officer at headquarters during a war. Everyone mourned over Samuel’s death as he was a great man of God, having served the Lord so faithfully since he was a young boy. I would hope to make such an impact for my God should He tarry that people would mourn over my death because I faithfully and unashamedly carried the truth of God’s Word to all.

Look what Saul had done, he put away (cleansed) the mediums, and spiritists (witches) out of the land. The Message Bible says “Saul had long since cleansed out all those who held séances with the dead” Good job Saul. But Saul was quickly about to face a battle against the Philistines that when “Saul saw the Philistine army, he was afraid; terror filled his heart” This king was terrified, what did he do, he sought the King of Kings, God.

Verse 5 shows the result which reads, “He inquired of the LORD, but the LORD did not answer him by dreams or Urim or prophets” God didn’t answer Saul, why? Verse 17-19 tells of the reason, and the bottom line again was his disobedience. God had ripped the kingdom off Saul’s hand and had given it to David. How did Saul find this out, through consulting Samuel? What I thought Samuel was dead. Oh yes, but Saul contacted the dead through one who contacted the dead regularly, named the Witch of Endor.

The very thing that Saul did away with, expelling the mediums and spiritists from the land, was the very thing he ran to when the battle came. He turned to the Devil’s servant and the Devil’s ways for the answer. Does that sound familiar to you? I feel like there has been times that I’ve thrown something away spiritually, only to go “digging through the garbage” to find it again. It could be pride, bitterness, lust, greed, envy, Unforgiveness, etc. The bottom line was it was in the garbage because it belonged there! Spiritually it is like Proverbs 26:11 states, “As a dog returns to its vomit, so a fool repeats his folly” I have at times unfortunately turned to ungodly things as if that was going to help me in a battle. It only made things worse, and ungodly things can NEVER produce godly results and victory. If God turned a deaf ear to me because of sin, I need to repent and let the Holy Spirit break me, humble me, and mold me into putty in the hands of God. Whether I am a prince or a pauper I need God’s favor and communication with my Father. Many times we can throw out the paraphernalia of sin such as ungodly books, magazines, CD’s, notes, pictures, etc., but it needs to be removed from the place that it is hidden most, in our minds and hearts. Romans 12:2, speaks about being “transformed by the renewing of your mind,” and that is what we need”

Application: Lord, help me not be a garbage picker or a dog that returns to its vomit. When I face life’s battles let me turn to You and Your Word which is truth as ammunition to fight against the enemy. Keep my life humble before you and may I sense at any time when my sweet communion with You is melting away. Keep me humble for You resist the proud but give grace to the humble. Amen. Blessings Pastor Phil

title.rendered: Fishing Jesus’ Way, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Jn 21:4 Early in the morning, Jesus stood on the shore, but the disciples did not realize that it was Jesus. Jn 21:5 He called out to them, “Friends, haven’t you any fish?” “No,” they answered. Jn 21:6 He said, “Throw your net on the right side of the boat and you will find some.” When they did, they were unable to haul the net in because of the large number of fish.

Anyone can do a job or task for a little while, but to do it daily and consistently now there’s a challenge. When Jesus first started to call his disciples he interrupted their lives and he called the two sets of brothers and would make them fishers of men.

In John 21, Jesus was standing on the shore, his disciples not realizing it was Him, and called out to them “Friends, haven’t you any fish?” “No,” they answered. Jn 21:6 He said, “Throw your net on the right side of the boat and you will find some.” The result was the following, “When they did, they were unable to haul the net in because of the large number of fish. They did it Jesus’ way and it yielded fish, because of their obedience. Again in Luke 5 we read another fish story account. Jesus told these men who were fishing all night, “Put out into deep water, and let down the nets for a catch.” Simon Peter replied by saying, “Master, we’ve worked hard all night and haven’t caught anything. But because you say so, I will let down the nets.” Simon could have argued with the notion that Jesus knew nothing about fishing since He Himself was a carpenter. But Peter obeyed because it was Jesus speaking. The outcome of that obedience was that

”When they had done so, they caught such a large number of fish that their nets began to break.” They caught fish because they did it Jesus’ way, not theirs.” Again they obeyed and caught fish. “When Simon Peter saw this, he fell at Jesus’ knees and said, “Go away from me, Lord; I am a sinful man!” 9 For he and all his companions were astonished at the catch of fish they had taken, 10 and so were James and John, the sons of Zebedee, Simon’s partners. Then Jesus said to Simon, “Don’t be afraid; from now on you will catch men.” 11 So they pulled their boats up on shore, left everything and followed him. We know that Jesus said 19 “Come, follow me,” Jesus said, “and I will make you fishers of men.” Jesus wants His fishers of men to fish His way. Hab 1:14 says, “You have made men like fish in the sea, like sea creatures that have no ruler.” Hos 4:3 states, “…Hos 4:3 …the fish of the sea are dying.” Isa 50:2 When I came, why was there no one? When I called, why was there no one to answer? Was my arm too short to ransom you? Do I lack the strength to rescue you? By a mere rebuke I dry up the sea, I turn rivers into a desert; their fish rot for lack of water and die of thirst.

The fish need to be fished for and be caught if they are to be saved. Yet we are fishing for men (people), and with that mandate seems to bring fear and possible disillusionment. Yet “We are called to be fishers of men (Matt. 4:19). “Program your mind into the mode that the fish God wants you to catch are upstream. To get them you will have to go against the current of self-will. Waves of fear and discouragement will thrust against you, but use the muscle the Spirit of God has put within you to fight against the tide.” (Ray Comfort)

Application:
1. Know where the fish are.
2. Go to where the fish are; don’t expect them to jump into the boat.
3. Use appropriate bait – speak the Word of God in ways they can understand, yet never water it down because fish have enough water.
4. GO fishing today for men (people) and don’t wait another day
5. Always listen to Jesus being sensitive to the voice of the Holy Spirit, and obey instantly Blessings Pastor Phil

title.rendered: That you may be rich, that you may be clothed, and that you may see.

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Revelation 3:18- I counsel you to buy from me gold refined in the fire, that you may be rich; and white garments, that you may be clothed, that the shame of your nakedness may not be revealed; and anoint your eyes with eye salve, that you may see.

By secular standards, true wealth is considered to be the accumulated gain one has horded to themselves. How sad though, that such a mindset has swept up the church, to the degree that many of today’s big name TV preachers tell the deceived masses that monetary gain is God’ s plan for them, and the surest sign of his blessing. Falsehood and lies I say. Look to our Lord, he had nowhere to lay His head, are we greater than Him? Here the inspired apostle pens the words of the glorified Christ, true counsel from Jesus’ heart. Here He gives us three things of value, three things that will truly enrich the life that is earnestly seeking after God. These are worth more than all this worlds riches combined.

1.) He counsels us to buy from Him gold, refined in the fire. This gold is the true, intimate knowledge of God known by all who would abandon themselves and seek Him in truth, true spiritual wealth, for the one who knows God is truly rich, not in the ways of this world which is passing away, but in eternal ways, those which shall last for eternity. The refining is the burning away of every desire but Him, all of our self-seeking, all of our asking of Him to gain for ourselves, instead of out of a humble desire and love for God.

2.) Next He counsels us to buy from Him white garments. Here is the true proof of a Christian, a holy heart and life. These are the pure garments of holiness, unspotted from the world, that every Christian is to be clothed with, for it is commanded of our God (I Peter 1:15-16) and it is required to enter Heaven’s gates, for without holiness we shall not see the Lord (Hebrews 12:14). We must be clothed in the wedding garments. The life of a Christian is marked by ongoing faith and obedience, for He that is truly born of God does not sin (has no sin as an option) (I John 5:18). The life of sin has been abandoned, we now pursue a life of holiness.

3.) Lastly He counsels us to buy form Him eye salve, that we may see, true spiritual illumination, that we may see our helpless state, and that we may bow our knee humbly before His majesty, in reverence and awe, surrendering our lives wholly to Him. We are either completely His, born of His spirit and dead to ourselves, or we are still under the sway of the evil one. We mustn’t let human reason and philosophy draw us away from the truth of what God’s word says.

Now you may ask, how is it that I buy these precious gems of the Christian life, how do I obtain what it is Jesus is telling me to purchase? The price is our lives, our desires, our wills. Renouncing the world and ourselves, and offering our lives as a living sacrifice to God Almighty, that He might do with us as He pleases. Our wills must be as His will, and He alone must be our desire. We must be willing to sell all to follow Him( Matt. 19:21). Then we will truly know Him, divine intimacy with the Lord of glory, Christ reining in our hearts, now and for all eternity.

In the love and truth of Christ, and for His glory alone, blessings Brother Ben

title.rendered: Keep Hope Alive, by Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Colossians 1:28, “… Christ in you, the hope of glory”

Hopeless people many times see no need to live. Many of the suicides are due to hopelessness. Over one million people commit suicide every year. The World Health Organization estimates that it is the thirteenth-leading cause of death worldwide and the National Safety Council rates it sixth in the United States. It is a leading cause of death among teenagers and adults under 35. I discover more that there are an estimated 10 to 20 million non-fatal attempted suicides every year worldwide.

In the midst of all these, I take comfort knowing that Hope keeps a man alive. As long as there is hope, regardless of what one has to go through, deal with and suffer, there will be something inside called hope propelling him or her to keep fighting till the end. The people, who have lost hope throw in the towel, call it a quit but the people who have hope, keep standing regardless of the time and season. Hope is being in the mode of expectation, anticipating, looking forward to. Hope is not about something that is uncertain, it’s certain but not yet realized.

Faith is the main thing that keeps hope alive. You hope for something that has not materialized yet and you can’t just stop thinking about it, talking about it, watching for it and waiting for it. In Luke 15, Jesus gives a parable of father who had two sons, we know the story is about the prodigal son. The younger son took away his in heritance and went to a far country and there wasted his substance with riotous living. When he came to his senses after spending everything and had nothing left, he decided to go back home. Meanwhile his father had been hoping, praying, waiting, and watching to see his son coming home one day. Luke 15:20, “And he rose, and came to his father. But when he was yet a great way off, his father saw him, and had compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him”. This father was not just passing by then saw his son, no, he had been hoping. For that reason he could not go into depression and fear could not keep him down for hope was keeping him alive and when what he hoped for arrived, he ran to receive his son. Hope will make you embrace promises, desires when they appear at a distance and when they appear, you will run to receive it.

A person who is hoping has themselves at rest, Psalm 16:9, “Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoices: my flesh shall rest in hope”. There is nothing as bad as being in a restless position. People on hoping mode also do other things to keep hope alive, Psalm 71:14, “But I will hope continually, and will yet praise thee more and more”. One can be on the hoping mode but can also be complaining and checking the time when it will happen. As for the Psalmist he says that he will hope continually, daily, consistently and to keep his hope alive, he will yet praise Him more and more. The reason why praising Him while on the hoping mode is vital, it keeps fueling faith in you to trust Him even more and not give up.

Colossians 1:28, “… Christ in you, the hope of glory”. What a way to hope when the greatest one in in you. Christ in us gives us assurance that as we hope, He is there with us and will never leave us. When we are getting discouraged and feel like giving up, His words of comfort and hope will keep us alive and kicking to trust Him. Him ordering the steps and guiding us teaches us to hope in Him even more for if He brought us this far, He can take us that far. If He provided for us then, He will do it again. If He fought for us then, we hope that He will do it again. If He provided a job then, He will do it again. We Hope in Him all day long.

Have you lost hope that you could get married, be in ministry, be used of Him, achieve your career or goal, become somebody or whatever it is? Don’t let hope die for He is in you, keep pumping it and living to the fullest, exercise things that will keep your hope alive and remember that Christ in you, the hope of glory, the hope of beauty, the hope of splendor, hope of magnificence, hope of wonder, hope of brilliance and many more. Keep Hope Alive!!!!! Blessings Ev

title.rendered: Let’s Make Him Look Good, by Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1 John 5:11, “And this is the testimony: that God has given us eternal life, and this life is in His Son”

Over the years I have learnt that whatever God does in our lives He does it for a reason. God does not hide His reasons from us neither does He beat about the bush to tell us why. He is a jealous God therefore whatever He does, He does it that He may look good. Remember the bible says, “He will share His glory with no one”?. See God blesses us in different ways that we may be a testimony of what He can do. He does it through us that people may know that He is able but what we fail many times to testify before people of what He has done. I believe one of the reasons why we feel we cannot testify is because we think people are going to feel that we are bragging or boasting through our testimony so we keep blessings to ourselves. I must admit that there are times I have felt this way and so I did not testify of His faithfulness.

I believe with all my heart that the number one reason why God blesses us is not for us be comfortable with the blessing but to bring glory to His name and show people what He can do so that when they are in need they can also go before God and trust Him. It’s good to be blessed and God loves to bless His children but when His children receive blessings and are quiet not testifying about them what happens?, there are no people who can tap into that reference that He is able. I would say, “This is sharing with Him His glory”. If you are used to making Him look good before men, He has no problem loading you with more blessings.

1 John 5:11, “And this is the testimony: that God has given us eternal life, and this life is in His Son”, John is giving us a testimony of what God has done, God giving us eternal life by Christ Jesus. He is making God look good. Go back to the old testament, we see many people like Abraham who were so much blessed, Moses makes God look good by testifying on behalf of Abraham. Solomon was blessed, he testified of God blessings and so was David and many more. We can trust God today to bless us because, before we came the people before us trusted in Him, testified of His faithfulness and our response was, “Lord if you blessed them, you can bless us too, and if they testified of how you blessed them, we will testify of how you’ve blessed men too”. This morning, I ask you to make Him look good. Think about the things He has done, spiritually, materially, financially, health wise. Find someone and share your testimony with them, share with me. Despite of what I’m trusting God for right now, I have so much God has done in my life, my marriage, ministry, job, and family I need to testify about. The testimony is not about me or you, the testimony is about Him. Let’s make Him look good,. Praises looks good on Him.. Blessings Ev,

title.rendered: Tears that touch the heart of God, by Sammy Tippit Ministries

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“Thou hast taken account of my wanderings; put my tears in Thy bottle; are {they} not in Thy book?” (Ps. 56:8 NAS).

As you search the church history, you’ll find people who have been greatly used of God have been men and women of prayer. They’ve learned to wait in the secret place of prayer allowing God to impart His heart to them. They’ve been people whose hearts have been passionate for the [same] things which God is passionate about.

George Mueller began orphanages for children in Bristol during the 1899s. He trusted God to meet their every need. He never asked for money, but he clothed, housed and fed many thousands of children. Near the end of his life he said that every person for whom he had prayed to come to Christ (with the exception of two), had come to know Christ as his Savior. After Mueller died, those two people also came to a personal knowledge of Christ.

David Brainard ministered among Indian tribes in the Northeastern part of the United States during the 1700s. It was said of him that the snow would melt underneath him because he prayed so long for the Indians. He was God’s instrument to bring many to the knowledge of the Savior.

When our hearts beat in harmony with God’s heart, He will do incredible things to bring to pass those things for which we have prayed. God’s heart breaks for a lost and dying world. When our hearts feel the same burden, we will cry unto Him and He will hear and answer us. The Psalmist said, “Those who sow in tears will reap with songs of joy. He who goes out weeping, carrying seed to sow, will return with songs of joy, carrying sheaves with him” (Ps. 126:5, 6 NIV).

When a mother weeps for a rebellious son, it touches God’s heart. When a father cries to God for His fallen children, it moves heaven to earth. When young people are broken over their schoolmates’ salvation, the Spirit of God is released from heaven to capture that school for Christ. God holds dear to His heart the tears of His children.

God has a bottle where He stores our tears; a book where He records our heartaches. As we weep for those who are without Christ, we must never forget that God has not forgotten. One day, in His time, He will open the heavens and pour out a blessing upon us that’s beyond imagination.

A pastor recently told me when his church put in new carpet for their prayer room, he made a special request of the Lord. He said, “Oh God, I pray that this carpet will be dedicated to You by the tears of your people.” Not long afterwards, his prayers were answered. The church had a series of “revival meetings” with Life Action Ministries. God moved during those days, and the prayer room was filled with people weeping in brokenness and repentance over their sins.

Tears touch the heart of God. He understands the hurts of humanity because He gave His own Son for those injured by their own sins. Perhaps the shortest and most powerful Scripture in the Bible is the one that simply says, “Jesus wept.” If God in human flesh wept, then we’ll also weep when we grasp His heart. If you find yourself weeping for the souls of man, remember God is storing your tears in a bottle. One day, He will open that bottle, and out of it will flow “rivers of living waters.”

Application: What names are attached to the tears that God is bottling up on your behalf? Blessings Submitted by Pastor Phil

title.rendered: Fight To Conquer, by Bro. Boaz

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“Fight the good fight of faith, lay hold on eternal life, where unto thou art also called, and has professed a good profession before many witnesses”. 1Timothy 6:12

“I have fought a good fight, I have finished my course, I have kept the faith: Henceforth there is laid up for me a crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, shall give meat that day: and not to me only, but unto all that love His appearing.” 2 Timothy 4:7

“For we wrestle or fight not against flesh and blood, but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this world” Ephesians 6:12

The above Scripture verses and many others in the Bible clearly indicate and confirm that Christians have a real enemy and are constantly engaged in real and fierce battles. Whether you believe it or not, you are a target of the devil. Satan’s goal is to oppose you and prevent you from being what God created you to be. He does not want you to reach your destiny in life. He hates your progress. Your prosperity intimidates him. Your ministry and service to God diminishes him to nothing. Your worship to God deprives him of what he longs for more than anything else. Your dreams of success in, for example, life, marriage, education, career, business, leadership, ministry, relationships, etc. gives the devil headache and he will do anything to hit back and stop you from succeeding God’s way. He can even attempt to substitute God’s plan and blessing with his own. His own may even look more attractive, appealing and rewarding, temporarily. But the truth of the matter is, “He comes to steal, kill, and destroy.” John 10:10). Satan can destroy you with a good thing just as much as he can destroy you with a bad thing. It does not matter to him what weapon he chooses from his arsenal. His goal is the same: conquer, destroy and kill you. What then should you do?

Get ready to fight for your blessings and for your destiny like a real soldier. There is no handout without battle. You must move swiftly and violently toward possession of what is yours. If you don’t, the devil will conquer you and you will miss the will of God. How can you be sure to conquer? What strategy can you use? What tools do you need?

I want to recommend three things you must do in order to conquer any enemy anywhere at any time:

1. Stand on the mountain top-God’s mountain. Look for the solid Rock of Ages, the Lord Jesus Christ and stand on His promises. Stand on His will. Stand on His faithfulness. Stand on His power and presence etc. Where you stand is important. That is what gives you strength and balance. If you are not standing, you are falling. When Moses was faced with an enemy, the Am’-a-lek, he went to the top of the hill (God’s hill) to stand there before God. Listen to what he said: “tomorrow I will stand on top of the hill with the rod of God in my hand.” Exodus 17:9

2. Take the rod of God in your hand and raise it up. That is what Moses did. Today, you don’t need a rod like that of Moses. The rod you need is the Word of God. Take the Bible in your hand and fill your heart and head with the Word. Meditate on it day and night. Apply what the Word says. Argue with the word in your mouth. Resist with the word. Reason with the word. Challenge with the word. Speak the Word. Our warfare largely involves “verbal exchange” with the enemy. Tell him “It is written”, then quote what is written. Satan fears the Word of God. He cannot argue with it. Because the word is truth, and he cannot handle truth.

3. Have supporters to help you along the way. No matter how strong, independent, confident, competent and experienced you are whether as a leader, preacher, husband, wife, young man or woman, parent, etc. you will need somebody or people to stand with you when the battle is hot and prolonged and you can no longer keep your hands up on the hill with God’s rod in your hand by yourself. Every one of us gets tired once in a while or often. We all need people in our lives who will love us, teach us, counsel us, encourage us or even rebukes and correct us so we can go the right direction. Without such people, and their invaluable support, we are bound to be defeated in the battle field. Moses knew the value of people and so brought a long with him to the top of the hill Aaron and Hur to support him. When his hands were up, Israel was winning. When his hands went down, because of tiredness, the enemy was winning. But when Aaron and Hur lifted up his hands, Israel prevailed. It took more than Moses, a great and experienced leader, to win his battle.

What about you? Are you ready to fight and win? Sure you can if you can do what has been proven to give victory. Today, review the battles you have fought and those you are fighting now. If you lost a battle, ask yourself why? If you didn’t fight right, rise up, pick up your weapons and fight to regain. Listen to God. Fight a good fight. And if you need help, don’t shy to ask. Better ask for help than die in the battle field or loose what was meant to be your destiny. God will help you. Pray for wisdom, courage and obedience. God bless you and May He give you victory in all areas of your life. Amen! Blessings Boaz

title.rendered: Carrying Treasure, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

2CO 4:7 But we have this treasure in jars of clay to show that this all-surpassing power is from God and not from us.”
If you needed the greatest treasure you owned, transported to a group of people that you destined to receive it that who would you entrust with it? Would you give it to the fierce warrior, or perhaps the brilliant scientist? Maybe the military soldiers should be charged with so great a treasure.

Look at the ones that God entrusted to carry His great treasure. He chose those who were frail, weak, fallible, and liable to sickness, persecution, and death. One blow could put an end to those picked by God just as any other man. Without the strength of the military bearing arms before them, they faithfully carry the gospel with the armor of God upon their lives, and the treasure within their lives. Yes God uses mere man to accomplish His great work, entrusting him with His great treasure, the gospel.

The Jars of Clay (earthen vessels) are ordinary people that serve an extraordinary God. God is the One that empowers the jars of clay. What can a jar of clay do, in and of itself? It can only contain that which is placed inside. And the only One that can place something inside is the One who formed the vessel of clay, the Potter. Remember the account of Jeremiah with at the potter’s house?

JER 18:1 This is the word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD: 2 “Go down to the potter’s house, and there I will give you my message.” 3 So I went down to the potter’s house, and I saw him working at the wheel. 4 But the pot he was shaping from the clay was marred in his hands; so the potter formed it into another pot, shaping it as seemed best to him.JER 18:5 Then the word of the LORD came to me: 6 “O house of Israel, can I not do with you as this potter does?” declares the LORD. “Like clay in the hand of the potter, so are you in my hand, O house of Israel.

The Potter was intent on forming the pot and fashioning it to His liking. He had in mind a purpose for the pot. For everything God forms is for God’s purpose and everything God forms He fills. When the earth was without form, God formed it and filled it with light, water, and life. God formed the ark (Noah just followed the blueprints) and filled it with the animals and Noah’s family. God formed the tabernacle and the temple and filled them with furniture and His presence. God’s desire is that He can do with us as ordinary clay pots and fill us with the all-surpassing power of the everlasting gospel.

In the children’s story the Tale of Three Trees each tree had a purpose for itself. The first tree boasted that it’s lumber would be used to make a great and beautiful treasure chest. The chest would be decorated with bright golden hinges and polished to a fine and shiny finish. Inside it would hold great riches, jewels which were the colors of the rainbow and gold and silver coins. Now the first tree that had dreamed of being a beautiful treasure chest was instead made into a manger. It was sold to a farmer who used it in his cave where he kept and fed his animals. From this manger the animals of the farm ate the hay that lay in it. Until one night a young woman and her husband came to the cave looking for shelter for themselves and their newborn baby. In that manger, they laid their infant son. It was at that moment that the tree knew that it held the greatest treasure in the world, God’s gift to mankind. And as the child lay sleeping in the manger, the angels sang and the stars shone brightly in the sky. See the full inspiring short story –

Application: But we have this treasure (the gospel) in jars of clay (our lives) to show that this all-surpassing power is from God and not from us.” What are you doing with the power in you to reach others for Christ?

Thanks, Ev

title.rendered: Daniel: a man of true desire, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“But Daniel purposed in his heart that he would not defile himself with the portion of the king’s meat, nor with the wine which he drank: therefore he requested of the prince of the eunuchs that he might not defile himself.” Dan. 1:8

As a Christian we certainly want to live in victory, but as you have found out there are times of temptations which test your resolve in the Lord. From the moment Daniel and his friends are taken captive and exiled, they are required to immerse themselves in the language and literature of the Babylonians (1:4), with its focus on sorcery, astrology and polytheism. This was an alien atmosphere and culture to these displaced Hebrew boys.

Although they were in an ungodly, foreign land, this ungodly land was not in them. They were in Babylon but not of it. Daniel and his friends had their hearts resolved in Yahweh; therefore they refused to compromise with their actions. Before a public victory comes, a private victory must take place within the heart. This can clearly be seen in the life of these Hebrews as “Daniel purposed in his heart that he would not defile himself with the portion of the king’s meat….” Daniels heart was set on Yahweh, his friends followed him in this desire as well, but now this desire certainly needed to be appropriated or fleshed out. Daniel didn’t just intend to keep himself pure for the Lord, he desired it.

In his book A Heart Ablaze, John Bevere points out the difference between an intention and a desire, showing they are not the same thing. Many have good and godly intentions, but when it comes time to implement that intention they don’t follow through, because it may not have been their true desire. He says, “Desire is the path that a person will take, no matter how good his intentions may be.” James 1:14 reads, “But every man is tempted, when he is drawn away of his own lust (desire), and enticed.” This verse speaks about desire on the negative side. Psalm 37:4 shows us the positive side, “Delight thyself also in the LORD: and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart.” Both verses show the power of desire. Our intentions are what we will do when it is convenient at the time, but our desires are what will drive us even when it’s not convenient.

Daniel’s true desire was stated when the Scripture reads, “But Daniel purposed [desired] in his heart…,” because he acted upon that desire in a time that was inconvenient for him. He made the request to the prince of the Eunuchs that he and his friends to be allowed to eat vegetables and water, and not be defiled by eating the king’s meat. Well at first the Eunuch didn’t go along with it because if the king saw the Hebrews looking worse (downtrodden) than the other young men their age, then the king would have had the Eunuchs head. However Daniel in his wisdom asked if perhaps the eunuch might allow them a test for only ten days to which it was agreed upon. Daniel true desire was to please not the king of Babylon but the King of Kings, the Lord.

Application: May you have your private victory today, to face the public challenge when tempted to sin. Blessings Pastor Phil

title.rendered: Educating for Citizenship / Dual Citizenship, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“But our citizenship is in heaven. And we eagerly await a Savior from there, the Lord Jesus Christ,” Phil 3:20

The US Department of Education has made educators aware of a new educational development called educating for citizenship. Most people spend one-third of their lives as children and two-thirds of their lives as adults. Educators are being instructed to educate children in respect to being not just adults, but furthermore viable and model citizens that serve their country well. According to the dictionary, a citizen is a person owing loyalty to and entitled by birth or naturalization to the protection of a state or nation. Another definition reads that a citizen is a resident of a city or town especially one entitled to vote and enjoy other privileges there.

The following is from the US Department of Ed. Website: Citizenship and Patriotism

Citizenship requires doing our share for our community and our country. Being a good citizen means caring about the good of society and participating actively to make things better. Research reveals that participating in community service programs and learning about the importance and value of serving others can be a powerful influence on positive character development. Patriotism is an important part of good citizenship. Patriotism is love of and loyalty to our country. It involves honoring the democratic ideals on which the country is based and expecting elected officials to do the same, respecting and obeying its laws and honoring its flag and other symbols. It also involves accepting the responsibilities of good citizenship, such as keeping informed about national issues, voting, volunteering

Christians have dual citizenship. That is to say they are a citizen of their country, USA, India, China, etc…, as well as a citizen in heaven. And just as most people will spend more time on the other side, the adult side of their lives as citizens so we too as Christians will spend more time on the other side, eternity! WOW, I was awed talking with a friend about the incredible parallel spiritual truth that we discovered while talking about education America can call themselves an American because some are aliens, outsiders, so not all that call themselves Christians are citizens of God’s Kingdom of heaven. There is such a thing as a false convert, but I will save that topic for another day. Spring boarding off definition of citizen, Christians have been born again and owe loyalty to their country (heaven), because they have been bought with a price (1 Cor. 6:20). The Apostle Paul reminds us that we have citizenship in heaven, and thus are entitled to the protection, rights, and privileges of that country. All I can think of is healing, salvation, power in the Holy Spirit, wisdom, spiritual gifts. The old cliché says of some that “some are so heavenly minded that they are no earthly good.” God sent us the perfect model citizen that was so heavenly minded and extremely earthly good simultaneously, and His name is JESUS (Jn. 13:15). Peter tells us, Dear friends, I urge you, as aliens and strangers in the world, to abstain from sinful desires, which war against your soul. Live such good lives among the pagans that, though they accuse you of doing wrong, they may see your good deeds and glorify God on the day he visits us (1 Pt. 2:11-12).” Are you living as a citizen of your earthly country and your Heavenly home? Remember where you will spend not two – thirds of your life, but you are living your eternal life right not, just waiting for the day He takes us home

Application: Ask yourself, the Lord and other Christians if they feel you are living as a good citizen of heaven. Allow them to tell you what you need to hear not just what you want to hear. Blessings Pastor Phil

BTW: please keep me in your prayers, I’m speaking at a breakfast at our church to about 50 men on prayers, I need God’s anointing to be bold, powerful message and hearts moved to change. Blessings Ev

title.rendered: The Seeker Is The Savior, part 2, by Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Luke 19:1-10, vs. 9 “Jesus said to him, “Today salvation has come to this house, because this man, too, is a son of Abraham. 10 For the Son of Man came to seek and to save the lost.”

If salvation is of the Lord, then we can tell when He is saving someone, we see repeated patterns. They are not satisfied with what they have and where they are, they are awakened to something bigger. What brought them satisfaction don’t bring them satisfaction anymore. The sin they loved they no longer do. Matthew 5:6, says, “Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, For they shall be filled”, for someone to hunger and thirst, there has to be something that drives the feeling. If the Lord is the seeker, then He is the one who puts the new desires. A cow thirsts for water when it leaks on salt. The shepherd that provides the salt is the same that leads to the water.

We see this with Zacchaeus, the bible says, “4 So he ran ahead and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see Him, for He was going to pass that way”. Those who sincerely desire a sight of Christ, like Zacchaeus, will break through opposition, and take pains to see him. They are hungry and thirsty for something bigger than what they have acquired. We see this also with Paul in Philippians 3:7, who said, “7 But what things were gain to me, these I have counted loss for Christ. 8 Yet indeed I also count all things loss for the excellence of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord, for whom I have suffered the loss of all things, and count them as rubbish, that I may gain Christ”

If Christ is seeking the unbeliever, He will put new desires in them. Read Ezekiel 36: 26, “ I will give you a new heart and put a new spirit within you; I will take the heart of stone out of your flesh and give you a heart of flesh. 27 I will put My Spirit within you and cause you to walk in My statutes, and you will keep My judgments and do them”, John 6:44, “ No one can come to Me unless the Father who sent Me draws him; and I will raise him up at the last day”

Jesus had just said how hard it is for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God, here we see Him seek a tax collector who is an outcast and rich to save him. Christ guides by his grace those who seem to be furthest from it, He is the seeker. Vs., 5 And when Jesus came to the place, He looked up and saw him, and said to him, “Zacchaeus, make haste and come down, for today I must stay at your house.” 6 So he made haste and came down, and received Him joyfully”. In the midst of that great crowd, He knew Zacchaeus and called him by name. What a strange mixture of passions must Zacchaeus have now felt, hearing one speak, as knowing both his name and his heart and would give him attention despite of who he was. Knowing he did not deserve anything, Christ invited himself to his house as his guest and he received Him joyfully. I’m glad that salvation is the best decision Christ ever made for me. He sought me and bought me with his redeeming blood. He came to dwell in a heart He had prepared.

Wherever Christ comes He opens the heart, and inclines it to receive Him. He that has a mind to know Christ, shall be known of Him. Those whom Christ calls, must humble themselves, and come down. We may well receive him joyfully, who brings all good with him. Whatever is impossible with man is possible with God, to continue, blessings Ev

title.rendered: The Seeker Is The Savior, part 1, by Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Luke 19:1-10, vs. 9 “Jesus said to him, “Today salvation has come to this house, because this man, too, is a son of Abraham. 10 For the Son of Man came to seek and to save the lost.”

I find it interesting that in Luke 18, Jesus gives a parable about a Pharisee and a tax collector, one proud and the other humble. Not long after, we see Jesus encountering with a rich young ruler (very proud) who went away sad when Jesus talked to him about the first commandment when he said, “.Sell all that you have and distribute to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow Me” Luke 18:22. Upon leaving, Jesus says in the presence of His disciples, “18:24 .”How hard it is for those who have riches to enter the kingdom of God! 25 For it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.” The disciples became puzzled by this statement to which they followed with a question, “Who then can be saved? Vs. 26, I love Jesus answer because it is the heartbeat of the gospel, 27 But He said, “The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.”

Luke 19:2, “Now behold, there was a man named Zacchaeus who was a chief tax collector, and he was rich”. Known from a single incident in the Gospel of Luke in which he became a follower of Jesus, Zacchaeus was a rich a tax collector under the Romans. He lived in Jericho, a customs station on a major trade route. Because of the way he had gained his wealth, townspeople viewed him as a man who was a sinner vs7. Publicans to which he was were considered sinners. It’s shocking to know that the name Zacchaeus means pure or righteous, something he was not when Jesus met him.

We are told, 3 And he sought to see who Jesus was, but could not because of the crowd, for he was of short stature. 4 So he ran ahead and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see Him, for He was going to pass that way “. I’m curious to know how Zacchaeus knew about Jesus, perhaps from Mathew encountering with Jesus in Mathew 9. Matthew was met by Christ the seeker of him. Matthew then throws a party for Jesus and invites other tax collectors. Though we are not told of Zacchaeus, could it be that he was present and something Jesus said captured his heart and wanted to see more of this man. Or the other thing to speculate, he may have missed the party and having heard others talk about this amazing Man/God who was willing to hang out with the outcast considered sinners, he couldn’t wait to see Him.

He sought diligently, despite obstacles due to his limitations, he ran a head and climbed up a tree to see Him. Those who sincerely desire a sight of Christ, like Zacchaeus, will break through opposition, and take pains to see him.

Zacchaeus appears to be the seeker, the truth of the matter is, and Christ is the seeker of those lost. Going back to Luke 18, the parable he gives perfectly fits the rich young ruler and Zacchaeus. Jesus already knew of these two as we read in the parable and He was about to demonstrate something to qualify His statement when He said, Luke 18:24 .”How hard it is for those who have riches to enter the kingdom of God! 25 For it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God 27 But He said, “The things which are impossible with men are possible with God”

Salvation is impossible with man but not with God and we will see that in this devotion. This is why I say many times, salvation cannot be manipulated, and no amount of prayers or even sinner’s prayer can save a person, not even the scripture verse. All these may instruct someone to the Savior but have no ability of their own to save. Psalm 3:8, “Salvation belongs to the Lord” It begins with Jesus the seeker and an end with Jesus the Savior and in between there is the sought that has God given desire to seek Him. To continue blessings Ev

title.rendered: Definition Of Good, by Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Psalm 100:5, “For the LORD is good; His mercy is everlasting, And His truth endures to all generations”

I’ve pondered on the word “GOOD” many times. I tried to define it but could not come up with a concrete definition. The dictionary would not give me a concrete answer either. There were some ideas suggesting what is good yet it would not pin point exactly what it is. What one group consider good may not be necessarily good to another group. What one generation embraces as good, may not be embraced by another generation. Do you have a definition of the word “Good”? can you share it with me?

Since I would not define good, I asked myself, then what do I consider good? Still no answer, then moved to this question, what is the standard of goodness? I wanted to answer it but asked myself another question, who sets the standard? I think I have used this analogy before, of a little girl looking at a white sheep and thinking how nice and clean the sheep looked until it began to snow,. At that moment she thought the sheep did not look as clean as she thought compared to the snow; Same sheep, different background.. Here was another question I asked myself I was exploring what “good is”, what are the requirements for something or someone to be good? I’m I good person? Does doing something good make someone a good person?

In the past I have asked different people if they considered themselves good and 90% said yes. I don’t know about you but I don’t consider myself a good person at all. I try to do good things to people but never see myself as good because I know I have issues. Imagine you have guests, you decide to make them an omelet, you have 6 fresh good eggs and 3 bad eggs I don’t think you would mixt the good eggs and the bad and present your omelet to your guests would you? The three bad eggs are enough to ruin the other six-by the way you only need 1 bad one to ruin all. The bible says in James 2:10, “For whosoever shall keep the whole law, and yet stumble at one point, he is guilty of all”. If I have a nice jar and I drop it and it cracks even a little bit, I have shattered it’s perfection. It’s goodness has been shattered.

In Luke 18:18 tells us about a certain ruler who came to Jesus and said, “Good Teacher”, what shall I do to inherit eternal life. I would imagine Jesus telling him how to but instead, he first defined what good is. vs. 19, “So Jesus said to him, “Why do you call Me good? No one is good but One, that is, God”. Jesus was and is God therefore He was good, the ruler thought he was good until Jesus gave him 5 commandments not related to men to which he hadn’t kept. Remember the girl who looked at the sheep? this man had passed the test before men until the snow of God’s righteousness fell (test before God) and saw himself under God’s background of what good is. At that point he saw he was not good at all and went away sad. He had not kept the first commandment. So God is the definition of good, look at His commandments and see that is the only one that has kept them because He is good. We sing God is good in every circumstance, in every situation. Computers are good sometimes and so is snow yet God is good ALL THE TIME. Listen to Paul speaking, a man who is responsible for most of the new testament, Romans 7:18, “For I know that in me (that is, in my flesh) nothing good dwells;” Romans 3:12, “They have all turned aside; They have together become unprofitable; There is none who does good, no, not one”. The only good thing in me is Christ Himself. When God looks at me He sees Christ and therefore He cannot deny Himself cause like Father like Son. I wanted to be discouraged because I wasn’t good but I thought to myself, as long as I am not good I need Him who is good, I depend on Him, I live for Him. If I had everything going on for me I would not need Him. I am not good but He is good, I do good things and He takes the credit. Psalm 100:5, “For the LORD is good; His mercy is everlasting, And His truth endures to all generations” Blessings Ev

title.rendered: The Submission of our will for that which is Perfect, by Bro Ben

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Romans 12:2- And do not be conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind, that you may prove what is that good and acceptable and perfect will of God.

This verse, written by the inspired pen of the Apostle Paul, speaks so clearly to the separation that God asks and requires of all who would name Him as their Lord. Too often today people claim the promises, but forget the conditions, and possibly the greatest condition of discipleship is the complete submission of our will for the perfect will of God. We often like to interpret God’s will as ours, but so often we are far from the mark. When one truly comes to Christ, when they are truly born again, they surrender their will at the cross. All sin, all willful transgression is forsaken, and we now walk by faith in obedience to the Word of God. We can go back, we can take up those things again, but to do so is to forfeit our standing in Christ. Faith is ongoing, always moving forward, unto the perfect will of God.

Paul here warns us not to be conformed, or fashioned, after this world. We are not to behave as this world, partaking in its lusts and entertainments, its drink and its delicacies. We are further instructed to be transformed, which is the same Greek word used for what happened on the Mount of Transfiguration, we are to be transfigured. We must undergo a divine change, we must be born again, by no other means can we come to God the Father, we must bear the resemblance of His Son. Next, Paul writes it is by the renewing of our minds this happens. The word renewing does not refer to some minor undertaking, no beloved, it means our minds are to be renovated, to be made completely new, where the old thoughts have passed away, I now have the mind of Christ. We no longer desire what we once did, we find less and less enjoyment in the things of this world. Our minds are made new, completely new, entirely renovated, everything has been torn down, the whole place gutted, and an entirely new structure is built, all upon Christ, for now I have lost sight of all else but Him. He has become everything to me, and I renounce all that is not of Him. This is the New Testament standard of Christianity.

All of this leads to the end result, that we may prove, that we may know, that perfect will of God. And what is the perfect will of God? Let us go to the Word. I Thessalonians 4:3- this is the will of God, your sanctification, your holiness. God’s will , after our salvation, is that we would be holy, now, in this life, by the internal workings of His divine grace in response to a heart fully surrendered to Him by a humble and contrite faith, a burning desire for a deeper walk with Him. This is the life pleasing to God. We must be holy as He is holy, and it will only come as we are willing to submit ourselves wholly unto Him. We cannot continue in sin and call ourselves Christians, we must forsake all to have Him. He is the Pearl of Great Price.

Pressing on, that I may lay hold of that for which Christ Jesus has also laid hold of me, blessings, Brother Ben

title.rendered: I’m Not Where I was, Part 2, by Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Mathew 9:20-22, “And suddenly, a woman who had a flow of blood for twelve years came from behind and touched the hem of His garment”

As we looked at the woman with the issue of blood yesterday, we could glean some principles from her story and apply it to our lives as we start a new year.

First things first, 1. Be a Jesus seeker: This woman in the midst of her situation became a Jesus seeker. She made it upon herself to find Jesus. Mathew 9:20, “And suddenly, a woman who had a flow of blood for twelve years came from behind and touched the hem of His garment”. She decided to make a quick move before the opportunity passed her by. It was either now or never. If you and I are going to make it this year, we must be like this woman who sought to be made well. She sought after the one who could make her well, it’s one thing to desire, it’s another thing to do something about it. Deuteronomy 4:29, “But from there you will seek the LORD your God, and you will find Him if you seek Him with all your heart and with all your soul”. Don’t wait for people to seek the Lord for you, be initiative, and wait on God. This woman had no time to seek special help from people for her condition, she knew who to call on, the reason she moved swiftly and not wait for any special treatment someone else might have given her. You seek the Lord and you will find Him. She did not care to see Him or talk to Him all she cared was a taste of what He had, the healing virtue. Can we get to that place where we are desperate to just have a glimpse of what He has?

2. Be you own best encourager: She became her best encourager. vs. 21, “For she said within herself, If I may but touch the hem of His garment, I shall be made whole”. If you have tried everything and failed, it takes a greater faith to attempt the impossible. Jesus had spoken to many, touched them and healed them, for this woman, her faith was just to touch what He is wearing was enough to make her whole. This faith did not just come about, she had to do something about it, and she became her best encourager. Faith is boosted when encouragement comes in. It’s good to have people encourage but sometimes it’s good to build your own foundation of encouragement. “I will make it despite what the enemy brings my way; I am determined not to remain in the same place forever. I may fall, stumble, or even cry but I will still make it because I know that He has something I don’t have. If I can just but touch Him, I will never be the same again.

3. Your yesterday cannot not shape your tomorrow: Her yesterday could not help her get where she was going. She had every reason to sit and cry over the past and how it should have turned out. At times you have to dry your tears over those who frustrated you or things that stood on the way and realize the Lord is not done with you yet. He is doing a new thing, Paul encourages himself by saying, Philippians 3:13… but one thing I do, forgetting those things which are behind and reaching forward to those things which are ahead”. The fact you and I are still here shows there are things that have been deposited in the womb of our spirits that cannot be negated by yesterdays’ issues. Yes there are a lot that had passed her by while she was still in her condition yet she understood that “Behold Christ makes all things new”. Tomorrow can be vibrant if your past is buried from haunting you.

4. Have hope and faith to make it: Regardless of who she was she still had hope and faith to make it. Anyone can believe God when things are going the right way or you can see how things will turn out. It takes a greater faith to believe God in the midst of hopelessness. Faith in God can move mighty mountains, that is what she had at the very hour of her hopelessness. She did not just believe and sit there, she put her faith to work by seeking to touch the hem of His garment. James 2:26, “…for faith without works is dead also”

We have an awesome opportunity to grow in the Lord this year. Refuse therefore to be where you were yesterday, move and let everyone know if you must, “I’m not where I was, don’t look for me on my yesterday’s issues and failures. I moved on, God is growing me in every aspect of my life” Blessings Ev

title.rendered: I’m Not Where I was, Part 1, by Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Mathew 9:20-22, “And suddenly, a woman who had a flow of blood for twelve years came from behind and touched the hem of His garment”

Happy New Year. It feels good to do devotions again after some time of silence, 4th quarter closings, was out sick for two days and my brother Jimmy got married. Let me encourage us as we start this new year.
Many make resolutions into the new year only to fail early due to making it by human efforts. Instead of making resolutions, I prefer making declarations for the new year. Declarations I commit to God knowing that I can only make it through Him. What amazes me about starting the new year is the fact that we are all anticipating a victorious, glorious year. You hear it said or even preached that this new year is going to be a greater than the previous year. I don’t think that is always the case. As yourself this question, was the previous year more great than the year before that? Can you say 2010 was better than 2009 and that 2009 was better than 2008? If we were to evaluate each year and be honest with yourself, there is a possibility that someone would say nothing or very little things changed. If anything, they might have been worse compared to the previous years. Great expectations in the new year, only to discover dealing with the same issues you dealt with in the previous year. Very discouraging.

We are all familiar with the story of the woman with the issue of blood. Her name is not given to us for it is not important to the revelation of the text however the bible take the time to tell us of her condition for 12 years. Like someone of us, maybe each year she expected to see her condition get better but each time it got worse. She was losing blood every year, she tried to do all that she needed to do to have her condition get better, not even once in those years did it. Mark 5:26, “… had suffered many things from many physicians. She had spent all that she had and was not better, but rather grew worse”. I’m not sure if she looked forward to a new year, I wouldn’t if I was in her condition especially for many years. She tried it all, spent it all, worked it all to get better in vain. It’s not a surprise if I heard that someone spent money on books, programs, counselors and the like to get things better in their marriage, raising children, finances, breaking out of a habit and more and still found that none of those worked. So what happens, you fall back on what you dealt with the previous year and you see the same happening in this year. Every good thing she would have loved in her life could not take place because of her condition.

Anyone with an issue of blood cannot get pregnant, they cannot hold what they should hold. You were considered unclean if you had an issue of blood. There could be no fellowship or relationship for that matter. If you have an issue, chances are, you cannot hold fellowship, relationships, the word of God, prayers, witnessing, enthusiasm for the things of God because you are bleeding. Things that would get you pregnant with destiny are aborted before time leaving you frustrated year after year. You try to do your best only to find that you are not going anywhere, if anything your condition is getting worse. Can we carry the same issues again in this new year? I don’t think so. I don’t want to deal with the same issues I dealt with in 2010, this is a new year with new beginning. 2010 is gone, we are committing 2011 in the hands of God. The enemy of our soul knows where we are today but don’t look for us in the same place tomorrow for God is radically changing the course of our destiny. What I leave us with this morning is this question, before you try and get pregnant with destiny, do you have issues of blood to deal with?. To continue Blessings, Ev,

title.rendered: For Unto Us A Child Is Born, by Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Isaiah 8:14, “Therefore the Lord Himself will give you a sign: Behold a virgin shall conceive and bear a Son, and shall call His name Immanuel.

It’s bright new day, a day that brings us even closer to Christmas day. It has been said that Christmas is the most wonderful time of the year. Each one has a good reason why they call it the most wonderful time of the year.

A prophesy about a Son to be born happened a few thousand years ago when God gave the prophesy after King Ahaz could not ask for a sign. And the prophesy was very clear about who will be born, how He will be conceived and even the name He was to be given, Immanuel which means God with us. Jesus was coming to this earth taking the form of flesh. I believe to redeem, He had to relate to us human form. He was 100% God and 100% Man, the infinite God Man. And when God brought Him into the world of sin, He made sure that no man contributed to His coming for man has the tendency of trying to take the glory and therefore He made Jesus be born of a virgin. He came to be the Savior of the world and be Lord of all.

Isaiah 9:6, “For unto us a Child is born, unto us a Son is given, And the government will be, upon His shoulder. And His name will be called Wonderful, Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace”. Can you imagine a child being born already give these titles? Watch this, after the prophesy in the book of Isaiah, Jesus is born and Matthew records the fulfillment of that prophesy, Math 1:22&23, “So all this was done that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying: Behold, the virgin shall be with a child, and bear a Son, and they shall call His name Immanuel,” which is translated, “God with us”.

The neat thing is that when Jesus was born, He was born already crowned the King of the Jews (Math 2:2), the wise men guided by the star come to worship the King of Jews also known as the King of kings, and not only did they come to worship, they also brought gifts with them. Can you see that Christmas is not about us but about the King of kings? yes we exchange gifts and yes sometimes we don’t want to call it Christmas for we would rather call it happy holidays or Xmas. Letter “X” in math is always considered the unknown number and when we use it in Xmas, to me that sounds like the unknown Man behind Christmas. Jesus Christ is the reason for Christmas and we come to worship Him just as the wise men who said let us go and meet the King of the Jews, bringing Him gifts. We can bring Him gifts of praise, worship, adoration and the like, it’s all about Him. Oh come let us adore Him, Christ the Lord.

As we celebrate Christmas, let’s remember that Jesus was born to be the Savior and the King of the world and that He is coming back again soon and this time He is not coming as baby in a manger but as the King of kings and the Lord of lords, Isaiah 9:7, “Of the increase of His government and peace, and there will be no end, Upon the throne of David and over His Kingdom, To order it and establish it with judgment and justice from that time forward, even forever. The zeal of the Lord of hosts will perform this”. Hallelujah, praised the Lord, Jesus is coming back as a Mighty Man of war. Let’s remember that even though we celebrate His birthday and we look at Him in a manger, He’s no longer the helpless infant in a manger, He is the King who sits on the throne. !!!!

Merry Christmas from Pastor Phil, myself and our wives, blessings

title.rendered: He is Looking For Obedience – Part 5, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Jn 6:66 From this time many of his disciples turned back and no longer followed him. Jn 6:67 “You do not want to leave too, do you?” Jesus asked the Twelve. Jn 6:68 Simon Peter answered him, “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life. Jn 6:69 We believe and know that you are the Holy One of God.” Jn 6:70 Then Jesus replied, “Have I not chosen you, the Twelve? Yet one of you is a devil!” Jn 6:71 (He meant Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot, who, though one of the Twelve, was later to betray him.)

What comes to mind when you hear the name Benedict Arnold? John Maxwell shares that many people in America associate his name with treachery and betrayal even though his actions occurred over two hundred years ago. And few remember that Arnold was a brilliant military leader).” He started out as one thing a brilliant, obedient follower and respectable military leader, but somewhere his heart ended up against the team and leadership he was allegedly committed to. Maxwell also shares that “Teammates must be able to count on each other when it counts.”

Remember when Moses choose 12 spies to enter the Promised Land yet only Joshua and Caleb brought a report back from the eyes of faith because they had God’s perspective? It’s funny I can’t remember the names of the other 10 spies, but only that they died not possessing the Land themselves. There were twelve called, but only two chosen as faithful.

Jesus had on “His team,” both true and false followers. John 6:66 is said to be one of the saddest verses in all of Scripture. Why is it that “From this time MANY of HIS DISCIPLES turned back and no longer followed Him?” Well Jesus placed a bench marker, or a scoreboard to divide the team into the fans of Jesus and the followers of Jesus. The fans will jump on the band wagon when the team appears to be winning, but followers are committed to their team and leader for better or for worse. In Jn. 6:53, “Jesus said to them, ‘I tell you the truth, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you have no life in you’”. Jesus drew the line in the sand and allowed each one to decide which side they would stand on. Jesus was in a sense pointing with one hand to Himself and the other to the exit door and saying as Joshua in Josh 24:15 “But if serving the LORD seems undesirable to you, then choose for yourselves this day whom you will serve…,” and so many left Him. Jesus said in Luke 9:62, “No one who puts his hand to the plow and looks back is fit for service in the kingdom of God.” These disciples not only looked back, but they went back. Jesus staked the claim that following Him was not to be carried on by sheer will power but by a Spirit following. Jesus said “The Spirit gives life; the flesh counts for nothing. The words I have spoken to you are spirit and they are life.”

John 6:67-71 reads, “Then he turned to His twelve and asked “You do not want to leave too, do you?”. Simon Peter answered him, “Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life. Jn 6:69 We believe and know that you are the Holy One of God.” Jn 6:70 Then Jesus replied, “Have I not chosen you, the Twelve? Yet one of you is a devil!” Jn 6:71 (He meant Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot, who, though one of the Twelve, was later to betray him.)

Consider this: Both Judas and Peter stayed with Jesus at this time, but were later on tested severely. Judas betrayed Jesus, and Peter denied Jesus. Peter repented and became a leader among the disciples, and Judas hung himself. Judas proved to be a false convert, and Peter a faithful disciple.

Perhaps this is why Jesus said, “The harvest is plentiful, but the workers are few. Ask the Lord of the harvest, therefore, to send out workers into his harvest field.”

Application: Where your test comes, and come it will, are you resolved in your heart now that you will follow Jesus no matter the cost? Are you going to be found as a walker or a worker? Blessings Pastor Phil

title.rendered: He is Looking For Obedience – Part 4, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“Not every one that saith unto me, ‘Lord, Lord’, shall enter into the kingdom of heaven; but he that doeth the will of my father which is in heaven. Many will say to me in that day, ‘Lord, Lord,’ have we not prophesied in thy name? and in thy name have cast out devils? and in thy name done many wonderful works? And then I will profess unto them, I never knew you: depart from me, ye that work iniquity (Matt. 7:21-23).”

Why does it seem like such a surprise to many people that Jesus is looking for their obedience? It seems pretty logical for Him to expect obedience from His Body, His Church, His Bride. Don’t you want your physical body to obey you? If you were in charge wouldn’t you expect those in your guidance to follow your instruction? If you are married is it not biblical for a bride to listen to their groom, as He loves her as Christ loves the church? And how did Jesus show His love for the church, he died for the Church, His Body, His Bride. Jesus just didn’t say He was going to die, Phil 2:8 says, “And being found in appearance as a man, he humbled himself and became obedient to death-even death on a cross! Phil 2:9 Therefore God exalted him to the highest place and gave him the name that is above every name”. Hebrews 5:8 shows how Jesus came to a place Himself of obedience as the writer points out, “Although He was a Son, He learned obedience from what He suffered 9 and, once made perfect, He became the source of eternal salvation for all who obey Him.” He was obedient to death on the cross, He learned obedience through what He suffered and because of that became the source of eternal salvation to all whom – OBEY HIM! Obedience is connected to someone’s salvation. Those who love Him, will obey Him thus showing their faith in Him by their works for Him (James 1).

However Matt 7 teaches that there are many that are in fact deceived in their thinking that they have eternal life in Him by their outward works, yet inwardly they do not do God’s will. Jesus stresses that not everyone that calls Him Lord, Lord which reflects both fervency and intimacy, has the depth of relationship that one may think. There will in fact be those that will be taken by surprise because they will be found to be outside of God’s will by Jesus Himself. There will be those that will have been exposed as false followers of Christ and it will be revealed on “that day” [Great Day], the Day of Judgment. Despite the fact that many will express their self – deception will be clearly seen by Christ in their deceptions. They will ask Christ “Did we not preach the message under the inspiration of the Spirit and exercise the prophetic office? Remember just because one prophesies, does not necessarily equal obedience. Could not an atheist read the Scripture to another and the hearer genuinely repent because of the power of the Word not the sanctity of the vessel?. This is why God hates the Lukewarm and will vomit them out of His mouth (Rev. 3:16) Did not God’s chosen man Saul fall guilty of prophesying all night with the prophets because the spirit of God came upon him, but yet he lived disobedient to the real King, God Himself, (1 Sam 19:20-24)?

The many will proclaim their piety, but it will be found to be false, and they will point to their works, but those too will be insufficient works. Romans 3:20 shows, “because by the works of the Law no flesh will be justified in His sight: for through the Law comes the knowledge of sin.” They will also try and have Jesus look to their deceptive miracles as well. These will all ask Jesus to look away from their obedience and only at their deceptive acts. While our acts and our obedience should be married to one another, these people will have them divorced from one another, and because obedience is not their defining marker they are only left to proclaim their deceptive acts. Look at the words Christ will give these folks, “I never knew you: depart from me, ye that work iniquity.” He says I never knew you. That is to say we never had an intimate relationship, and I never approved of your lifestyle. Jesus Christ learned obedience, modeled it for us, and expects it from us that say we follow Him. Let’s obey Him, its best for us.

Application: 2Co 10:5 We demolish arguments and every pretension that sets itself up against the knowledge of God, and we take captive every thought to make it obedient to Christ. Blessings Pastor Phil

title.rendered: He is Looking For Obedience – Part 3, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Now Jesus’ mother and brothers came to see him, but they were not able to get near him because of the crowd. Luke 8:20 Someone told him, “Your mother and brothers are standing outside, wanting to see you.” Luke 8:21 He replied, “My mother and brothers are those who hear God’s word and put it into practice.” (Luke 8:19-21

Isn’t it interesting that you can grow up with your family members, but in the long run some of our friends are closer to us in relationship than our own family? In the church world this would be labeled as a having a kindred spirit. This is where you and your friend (perhaps your best friend) seem to be so closely connected, you trust one another deeply there for one another faithfully and sacrificially, that it supersedes your relationship to your family. It’s been said that blood is thicker than water. This is to say that family relationship is to be a stronger than a friendship one because of the family bloodline. Perhaps this saying was made up by someone that saw the closeness of two friends as being greater than the closeness of one of their family members and them, this statement was born out of jealousy. Even though the saying blood is thicker than water is believed by many, perhaps spirit is thicker than blood, or better yet the blood and spirit of Jesus is thicker than anything.

Jesus’ mother Mary came to see Him along with His brothers. Jesus was inside ministering or at least being with people. There was enough of a crowd gathered there to keep His family from getting near to Him. Upon hearing that His own mother that gave birth to Him, and nurtured Him growing up, and His own brothers that He had grown up with desired to see Him, He answers to the surprise of many with unexpected words. Knowing His family came to see Him, Jesus says “My mother and brothers are those who hear God’s word and put it into practice.” Now talk about throwing someone off. Jesus seems to make no exception to have His family members outside come to see Him, and He rolls no red carpet out to them. On the contrary if there had been a “red carpet” it appears that He would pull it away. By the very statement given to Jesus, one would expect a much different response, especially in a society where honoring your father and mother was highly esteemed. Yet Jesus gave no more honor to His mom and brothers than the rest of humanity. As blessed as Mary was for being chosen by God to be the mother of Christ, she and His brothers were to submit to the family as Jesus defined it, as He said “My mother and brothers are those who hear God’s word and put it into practice.” “Jesus says that the way to be close to him-even as close as His own family-is through being receptive to (“hearing”) God’s word and then doing it. Hours of praying and reading the Bible will not bring disobedient Christians as close to the Lord as doing His truth brings even the simplest believer (EBC).”

Later on in the book of Luke, a woman in the crowd called out, “Blessed is the mother who gave you birth and nursed you.” He replied, “Blessed rather are those who hear the word of God and obey it (Luke 11:27-28).” He is looking for obedience to define His family. This is really nothing new as Jesus is consistent even from His boyhood. Remember at the age twelve Mary and Joseph accidentally left Jesus in Jerusalem, and upon their return being very anxious, His mother said to him, “Son, why have you treated us like this? Your father and I have been anxiously searching for you.” Why were you searching for me?” He asked. “Didn’t you know I had to be in my Father’s house (NIV), [“…dealing with the things of my father” – the message Bible] (Luke 2:48-49)?” Later Luke shows the place family must take in the life of one who desires to be Jesus’ disciple (14:25-26). Jesus states, “If anyone comes to me and does not hate his father and mother, his wife and children, his brothers and sisters-yes, even his own life-he cannot be my disciple.” He is to be at the top of your “love list” shown through obedience. Even Jesus’ half-brother James who did not believe until after Jesus’ death stated, “But be doers of the word and not hearers only deceiving your own selves.” James 1:22, He too recognized that those who call themselves followers of Christ must manifest the words through their obedience to His Words. Apart from obedience growing up in a Christian home, going to church, and practicing spiritual disciplines can never outweigh the simplicity of obedience, which is what He wants from His Church, His Body, and His bride.

Application: If you were placed on trial for being a Christian, would there be enough evidence to convict you? Blessings Pastor Phil
