title.rendered: He is Looking For Obedience – Part 2, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Sa 15:22 But Samuel replied: “Does the LORD delight in burnt offerings and sacrifices as much as in obeying the voice of the LORD? To obey is better than sacrifice, and to heed is better than the fat of rams. 1Sa 15:23 For rebellion is like the sin of divination, and arrogance like the evil of idolatry”

In Luke 6:46, Jesus asks this question, “Why do you call me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ and do not do what I say? He is trying to show some common sense in this passage. He asks in the first part of his question, “Why do you call me Lord,” of your life and yet you don’t obey me as Lord? Doesn’t Lord have some clout to it, showing a place of supreme importance? In Hebrew the word Lord means “”supreme in authority, controller, (as respectful title) God, Lord, master, sir. Seeing this definition gives credence to his question. Think of a building land lord. He is the lord of that land. If the land lord says you can live here or you can’t live here, they are the lord of the land (building) and therefore their word goes. In the second aspect of His question notice he doesn’t say “You don’t hear the things I say,” but rather you “…do not do what I say.” The Message Bible says it like this, “Why are you so polite with me, always saying ‘Yes, sir,’ and ‘That’s right, sir,’ but never doing a thing I tell you?” Jesus is trying to show the inconsistency that He sees, with calling the person in charge, Jesus, Lord, yet disobeying His will. You can’t call Jesus Christ Lord and yet still live completely contrary to His Word. If you do, it only proves that He is not really your Lord.

Matt 7:6-8 illustrates this beautifully as Jesus says, He replied, “Isaiah was right when he prophesied about you hypocrites; as it is written: “‘These people honor me with their lips, but their hearts are far from me. They worship me in vain; their teachings are but rules taught by men.’ You have let go of the commands of God and are holding on to the traditions of men.” Notice the words near and far. These people Jesus is speaking of had lips that were near calling Him Lord, yet their heart of obedience was far from His heart and will. Jesus doesn’t want mere lip service, but a surrendered heart service. The position of your heart, near or far, will determine the position of your obedience.

Hear the words of doctor Luke as he wrote Jesus’ analogy on the wise and foolish builders. Luke 6:47-49 reads, “I will show you what he is like who comes to me and hears my words and puts them into practice. He is like a man building a house, who dug down deep and laid the foundation on rock. When a flood came, the torrent struck that house but could not shake it, because it was well built. But the one who hears my words and does not put them into practice is like a man who built a house on the ground without a foundation. The moment the torrent struck that house, it collapsed and its destruction was complete.”

Jesus is showing that there is no way your life is going to crash by the weather patterns of life when you are obedient to His word, but the disobedient life will have a complete collapse and total destruction. The testing ground will determine if the kind of person you profess to be, an obedience follower, is what you really are.

Consider the words of the Apostle Paul, In 1 Cor 13 known as the “love chapter.” “If I speak in the tongues of men and of angels, but have not love, I am only a resounding gong or a clanging cymbal. If I have the gift of prophecy and can fathom all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I have a faith that can move mountains, but have not love, I am nothing. If I give all I possess to the poor and surrender my body to the flames, but have not love, I gain nothing.” I personally don’t promote this movie however a friend of mine used to utter these words from the movie Billy Madison when he said, “I see your lips moving but I can’t hear your words.” Jesus sees many lips moving but He wants those moving lips to translate into obedient words shown by a tested life which displays faithful obedience to the Lord.

Application: Do you call Him Lord, and if so where is you obedience? Where is your heart today near or far? Read Psalm 139:24 – 25, Blessings Pastor Phil

title.rendered: He Is Looking For Obedience – Part 1, by Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Sa 15:22 But Samuel replied: “Does the LORD delight in burnt offerings and sacrifices as much as in obeying the voice of the LORD? To obey is better than sacrifice, and to heed is better than the fat of rams. 1Sa 15:23 For rebellion is like the sin of divination, and arrogance like the evil of idolatry.

TV preachers, videos, magazines, radio, books, seminars, conventions, websites, and local church preachers all give us information. As a matter of fact we are in an age where information is in abundance. There are so many avenues by which we can “hear” information. And when it comes to hearing godly things this too is not scarce. However, despite all of this hearing, how much of it do we actually apply to our lives? Jesus made a definite distinction between hearing and listening or better yet obeying. I once heard it said, hearing is what we do with our ears, listening is what we do between them. Jesus gives an analogy of two lives. In Matt 7:24-27 He says, “Therefore everyone who hears these words of mine and puts them into practice is like a wise man who built his house on the rock. 25 The rain came down, the streams rose, and the winds blew and beat against that house; yet it did not fall, because it had its foundation on the rock. 26 But everyone who hears these words of mine and does not put them into practice is like a foolish man who built his house on sand. 27 The rain came down, the streams rose, and the winds blew and beat against that house, and it fell with a great crash.”

He stressed that live issues will beat our lives. There are many issues such as relationships, family, finances, employment, and health, to name a few. And like weather patterns the floods, rains, and winds of life will attack our lives without favoritism. It’s interesting that Jesus likened the two houses to two lives, both of which had heard His everlasting words. Yet only one of the houses remains intact after the storms of life hit. And it was only the house that stood the test of time that Jesus commended. In fact He called this house the wise man. Why, because this was the one that applied or obeyed His words and did more than simply hear His words. Jesus gives no second place, no silver medal to the life of a mere hearer, or to say plainly the disobedient life. Hearing is the starting place, but listening is running to the finishing line! Jesus was illustrating that you are either convinced by the Spirit of God of my teaching and it becomes the very foundation of rock to sustain your life. Or you truly are in doubt because although you hear, you show outwardly by the failure to apply my Words to your life, that you chose to build your life as a sandcastle rather than a strong tower.

This life Jesus called a foolish one. You see Jesus was never at a loss for crowds, but He wasn’t after crowds for the sake of just having a crowd. He gathered crowds from the beginning of His earthly ministry all the way to His crucifixion and beyond, no, He desired the crowd to become obedient followers of Him. If there is an area that needs improvement in our Christians lives it surely is this whole issue of obedience. Now who among us can say that we display perfect obedience? I imagine that no one would raise their hand to proclaim their perfection based on their actions. Yet this is precisely what Jesus is and has been calling for, obedience. There is a clear distinction, either your house is built on the rock or on the sand. Even a child can kick over a sandcastle, no matter how ornate the builder may have made it. God only builds with rock. People will either have their lives built on the shifting sands of this world, by only hearing and thus failing to apply the words of Christ, or they will know that God is the builder of their house because they apply His words to their lives. Psalm 127:1 reads, “Unless the LORD builds the house, its builder’s labor in vain.” In speaking of the faith of Abraham Hebrew 11:10 states, “For he was looking forward to the city with foundations, whose architect and builder is God.” God builds on obedience, for then our lives are pliable for Him to make, mold, and build us in the way He knows best. He is the diving carpenter; will His hands find an obedient and humble life or a prideful and foolish one?

Application: In what area do you find it most difficult to obey God and why? What are you going to do about it? Blessings Pastor Phil

title.rendered: Many a slip…. , devotion by Sis. Bala Samson

content.rendered:
Numbers 33:38 ‘Then Aaron the priest went up to Mount Hor at the command of the LORD, and died there in the fortieth year after the children of Israel had come out of the land of Egypt, on the first day of the fifth month.’

There’s many a slip between the cup and the lip! Beware! People who are dancing and prancing around, delighted over their love for God, should also be careful to walk in His ways! It is not over with you saying, ‘I love you Jesus’, but you need to live it out! Did you hear me please? That’s when you can stand against the enemy! We read in Deuteronomy 4:5 “Surely I have taught you statutes and judgments, just as the LORD my God commanded me, that you should act according to them in the land which you go to possess.”

Alas, there are many people who say that they love Jesus, yet, have made a bunch of wrong decisions, which has become a snare in their life. I know of a young girl who traveled from a different city and attended our all-night prayer, yet, one month after that, she got married to a hindu man and he has thereafter become a snare in her life. They live separately now, and she is in deep sorrow. Friend, the Bible clearly warns us to be ‘overcomers’ until the end.. is it not? Revelation 2:7 says “He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches. To him who overcomes I will give to eat from the tree of life, which is in the midst of the Paradise of God.” We’ve got to squash the temptations that come gushing on us.. that’s when we can taste victory.

Let me tell you, you don’t become a monk or a one hundred percent saint, the moment you surrender your life to Jesus, in fact, the temptations becomes stronger, more intense and acute as you get closer to Jesus. Mark that! Your heart beats, your eyes pop out., everything that used to happen before, does happen now, but the good news is, YOU DON’T GIVE IN TO TEMPTATION ANYMORE. La, la, la. let us shout Hallelujah! I talk to you guys openly because, I don’t want you to shrink and feel guilty, when those feelings does come on you, because the enemy plants all those things in the mind. But we can do the victory dance, when we give the enemy a kick and tell him, ‘it will not work with me, because I have Jesus spread all over me.’ Amen. I’m simply anointed as I write this message today! My dear friends, make it a goal in life to live a holy life. You need to work on that, though. I have said ‘no’ to secular movies, secular magazines, gossip zones (even when I travel alone for ministry, I stick to my room)and anything that would bring a wall between me and God. I aggressively stick to Him – without which the devil would play football with us.

Aaron (brother of Moses) started his ministry with a bang, being the mouth piece for Moses and was also the man to first perform signs and wonders in front of the people. Imagine! Exodus 4:30’And Aaron spoke all the words which the LORD had spoken to Moses. Then he did the signs in the sight of the people.’ However, the above scripture states that on the fortieth year – that is the last year of their wandering in the desert, when they were almost in the border of Canaan – both Moses and Aaron made a mistake and they died without seeing the promised land. Very sad! I meditated this scripture for long.. before starting to write the devotion. Let this message come as a warning alarm to all of you! Let Heaven be our ultimate plan for life!

Do not be lackadaisical in your walk with God. Be committed and faithful to God. Stay away from sin. Blessings Sis Bala

title.rendered: Turning Your Mountain Into A Plain, By Boaz

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“Not by might, nor by power, but by my Spirit, says the Lord of hosts.” Zechariah 4:6

Are you facing any obstacle, challenge, situation or threats, which are like huge and impossible mountains to climb? Are you right now having piled up needs like a high mountain? Do you feel discouraged and distressed over some things that do not seem to give up, no matter how much you pray? Are there issues in your life and around you, which have built up into mountains too high for you to climb? Do you feel like giving up, at times, because you do not seem to be heading the right direction or realizing your dreams or having your desires met?

Whatever your case may be, I want you to know that there is no mountain standing on your way, which can stop you from becoming the person God created you to be. Obstacles, which appear like huge mountains can be great stepping-stones to greater victories and success in our lives. Without them, we would not know how powerful our God is and the value of His grace upon our lives.

If you want to turn any mountain in your life to a flat plain, there are three steps I recommend to you take today and always, whenever you face the impossible mountains:

1. Decide to depend entire and totally on the Spirit of God for your victory. Your strength, strategies, ideas, friends, church, family, finances, talents, skills etc. may be great and helpful, but will not by themselves push any mountain from your way. You need God “For it is not by might (personal strength or power) by my Sprit says the Lord. God is dependable and capable of meeting any need, if it’s according to His will. He is God of all flesh and nothing is impossible with Him (Jeremiah 32:27).

2. Determine in your heart to finish whatever you have started. Run to finish the race (1Corinthians 9: 24-27). Many people quit salvation, relationships, marriages, ministry, dreams and projects they started because they came a cross impossible mountains. Ze-rub-ba-bel, in the passage I referred to, was assure that if he stayed on, he would finish what he had started, not by his might but by the Spirit of God.

3. Despise not the days of small beginnings or small things. Rejoice over your small achievements and praise the Lord for them. Give thanks in all things at all times. Testify of the Lords power and provisions in your life. Exalt Him and give Him the glory for the great things He has done and has promised to do. Remember great things grow from small beginnings. Mighty oak trees grow from tiny seeds. There is a seed of greatness planted in you. It needs time for it to grow into its fullest potential. Trust God. Look up to Him for help. Your up look will determine your outlook. Let Him turn every mountain in your life into a flat plain. Blessings Boaz, Amen!

title.rendered: Abrasive or Anointed Relationship? By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

“Then Jesus six days before the Passover came to Bethany, where Lazarus was which had been dead, whom he raised from the dead. There they made him a supper; and Martha served: but Lazarus was one of them that sat at the table with him. 3 Then took Mary a pound of ointment of spikenard, very costly, and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hair: and the house was filled with the odor of the ointment. Then said one of his disciples, Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, which should betray him, Why was not this ointment sold for three hundred pence, and given to the poor? This he said, not that he cared for the poor; but because he was a thief, and had the bag, and bare what was put therein. Then said Jesus, Let her alone: against the day of my burying has she kept this. For the poor always you have with you; but me you have not always.” (John 12:1-7)

Jesus was getting closer toward the end when he would go to the cross. The relationships he made during his time would now begin to show their true colors, and some would be as precious oil, while others would be as abrasive sandpaper.

In this passage fiver names, which represent four relationships are mentioned which are Lazarus, Martha, Mary and Judas. How did each relationship form, and where is the relationship at this point leading up to His final days, as oil or sandpaper?

Fist, Lazarus we know was the man that Jesus loved and raised from the dead. Lazarus had been in a tomb. All his dreams, goals, aspirations, and relationship were dead with him. He was wrapped up like a Christmas present, but he didn’t look pretty. He was in this tomb four days which was significant because after three days all hope of resuscitation from a coma would be abandoned; and in the hot Palestinian climate, decay would have begun. Jesus said to a worrying Martha that was helpless with her abilities in this situation, “Your brother will rise again.” Misunderstanding Him, she thought on the Pharisaic belief in an ultimate resurrection for the just (Acts 23:7). However Jesus walked up to the tomb, called for the stone to be removed and cried with a loud voice, “Lazarus, come forth.” The words of Jesus cut through the icy grip of death like a white-hot blade through soft powdered snow. Death’s stinger is removed, and its grip relinquished as Lazarus walked out of tomb, alive again. Now here he is sitting with Jesus the one that gave him back his life, restored his dreams, and his relationships. He was closely following the one that saved his life. I believe that he is being like oil to Jesus by being with him. How closely are you following the Lord that called you from death unto life?

Secondly, Martha was serving doing what she is known for. In times past when Jesus had been to Martha’s home, she ran around doing for Jesus stuff, but never stopped to just spend time with Jesus. When Mary sat with Jesus he said that Mary had chosen the better. It seems at this time that not much had changed. She was still a busybody for Jesus, and even though I’m sure Jesus appreciated her efforts on one hand, He had wanted her to sit and be with Him. I believe she acted as a little oil to Christ, as she was still serving him, but she could have been more like soothing oil if she would slow down and just be with him. Are you so busy for Jesus that you never slow down just to be with Jesus? If the Devil can’t tempt us to sin, he can just keep us busy instead. Where is your level of busyness at verses your level of intimacy with Christ?

Application: Are you more like Lazarus being with Christ or more like Martha busy for Christ? Make the change today that needs to be made. Blessings Pastor Phil

title.rendered: Guilty Of Love, Part 2, by Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1John 3:1&2, ‘Behold, what manner of love the Father hath bestowed upon us, that we should be called the sons of God: … Beloved, now are we the sons of God, and it doth not yet appear what we shall be: but we know that, when he shall appear, we shall be like him; for we shall see Him as He is’ (KJV)

We looked at the love of the Father bestowed upon His children. The Father loved His children so much He demonstrated it by sending His Only begotten Son to die for us. John reminds us that no longer are we referred to us children of God but sons (daughters) of God.

Listen to this part “Beloved, now are we the sons of God, and it doth not yet appear what we shall be: but we know that, when he shall appear, we shall be like Him; for we shall see Him as He is” . From being bestowed to being called beloved; and from should to now sons, passing from death to life. This is where we need to identify with our new birth because someone who was guilty of love brought us to a new level we never deserved.

We are daily being conformed to the image of Christ. Being transformed to be like Him, Philippians 2:5, “Let this mind be in you which was also in Christ Jesus”, this is love of Christ to the point of death. So if the mind of Christ was to do the will of the Father, what is required of us now that He has appeared to us?, John says, “We shall be like Him” in other words we will also be guilty of love because we have learnt what it means to be loved. What did Jesus say in John 15:10, “If you keep My commandments (teachings), you will abide in My love, just as I have kept My Father’s commandments and abide in His love”. John 14:15, “If you love Me, keep My commandments”. This is how we demonstrate our love for Him by keeping His commandments (teaching, statutes). When you love someone, you do things to please them and we love God enough to desire to please Him in words, thoughts and deeds. Pleasing the Lord is what matters to me.

John’s writing on love blows my mind because he teaches us that one aspect of loving God is loving our neighbors (brothers). 1John 3:10, “…Whoever does not practice righteousness is not of God, nor is he who does not love his brother”. He goes a head to remind us of Christ’s love that we may adopt His lifestyle of the outworking of love, 1John 3:16,” By this we know love, because He laid down His life for us. And we also ought to lay down our lives for the brethren”. Are we guilty of love or are we guilty of not loving our brothers?. We are not told to love with words but love in action, 1John 3:18, “My little children, let us not love in word or in tongue, but in deed and in truth”. God will not tell us to do what He has not done Himself, He put it all on the line and we have to put it all on the line. Take time to read 1John 3 and 4, there is so much in them. Blessings Ev, God’s servant

title.rendered: Guilty Of Love, Part 1, by Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1John 3:1&2, ‘Behold, what manner of love the Father hath bestowed upon us, that we should be called the sons of God: … Beloved, now are we the sons of God, and it doth not yet appear what we shall be: but we know that, when he shall appear, we shall be like him; for we shall see Him as He is’ (KJV)

I would like to thank the few who did email me your testimonies, they were really encouraging as they made God look good. Let me take a few minutes and share something the Lord dropped in my spirit this morning. Everyone desires to be accepted and beyond that loved. Love goes far beyond like for instance, there are those people you don’t like yet you love them. You will cry at their funeral but will not go on a vacation with them yet you love them. Knowing that you are loved gives you a sense of belonging and worth and who does not want that?

In my text this morning, we hear John talking to us about the love of God. He starts by saying ‘behold’ by which he is bringing to our attention. I know of people who walk around as though they are not loved and it’s because they have never gone past their guilt and failure to know that God does not love us based on what we did. His love to us is based on what He did. Therefore there is nothing we can do to make God love us more and there is nothing we can do to make God loves us less. His love is unconditional, does not have boundaries and has no limitations. So John says look, walk in it, live in it. ‘What manner of love the Father has bestowed upon us’, when I study the word of God, I like to pick out some words used and understand what their meaning in relation to the revelation of the text. Let’s look at the word ‘Manner’, which is a way of acting and how did God act to show us He loved us? He did not just say it, He demonstrated it. Romans 5:8, ‘But God demonstrated His love towards us in that while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us’. If you love someone, you will not just love them with your words, you will demonstrate it. Jesus was guilty of that account and that guilt of love put Him on the cross. He wasn’t put on the cross because He was guilty of sin. John sees this kind of love and reports it to us. Here was a Man who put it all on the line. We would like to love those who love us back yet Jesus loved all knowing that one would betray Him, another will deny Him and He would be left alone, what manner of love?. His love was bestowed upon us in other words given to us as a gift. We never deserved or qualified for it, it’s just bestowed.

Amazing thing, with that love we now should be called the sons (daughters) of God. Being referred to as a child of God does make an impact like being referred to as a son or a daughter of God. That is so personal because I am beginning to understand that He loves me to call me His son and I can call Him My Father and better yet, My Daddy. If no one ever tells you they love you, just walk to the mirror, look at yourself and say, ‘HE LOVES ME’. I can’t rub off that love, can no one tell me otherwise because I know that His love for me is better than life itself. He loved me enough to die for me, He put His love on the line for me, there is nothing I can do to make Him love me more or less all I know is that, ‘He loves me’. If we were to say Christ was guilty, we would say He was guilty of loving us. To finish, blessings Ev, God’s servant

title.rendered: Condemned Yet Forgiven, Part 2, by Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 8:1-11, “…And Jesus said to her, “Neither do I condemn you; go and sin no more”

Yesterday we looked at an episode where a woman caught in adultery was brought to Jesus for justice. She was condemned because of what she did, Jesus takes the opportunity to ask her accusers to throw a stone at her if none of them had sinned. John 8:9, “Then those who heard it, being convicted by their own conscience, went out one by one beginning with the oldest even to the least”. Looking at this verse, Jesus did not condemn the Scribes and the Pharisees, what He said to them caused them to be convicted by their own conscience. The word conscience comes from two words “Con” which is “with” while “Science” is “knowledge”. They knew they own guilty state because their conscience convicted them.

I don’t know about you but I am glad that they brought her to Jesus. When I have fallen and deserve to be stoned, please take me to Jesus the one full of compassion, full of mercy, full of grace. He does not condone sin but He sure loves the sinner. As for this woman, Jesus did not like her sin and could not just say it was okay, she was condemned already but He loved her so much to bring her out of condemnation. John 8:10, “When Jesus had raised Himself up and saw no one but the woman, He said to her, “Woman, where are those accusers of yours? Has no one condemned you”, vs. 11, “She said, “No one Lord”. If everyone left, why would Jesus not leave. Very simple, everyone who left had committed sin but Jesus was pure. The bible says that He was a 100% man yet without sin. The Lamb of God with no spots or wrinkles. He was complete within Himself lacking nothing. Here is a woman left before Jesus with three words keep ringing in her mind, guilty, guilty, guilty. Can you imagine what must have been going through her mind at that time? At first she knew of what would happen according to the law of Moses and that is to die, but that has been put aside, “what is he going to do with me? must have through her mind. John 8:11,”…And Jesus said to her, “Neither do I condemn you; go and sin no more”. Did she hear Him correctly about what He said, “He has no sin and yet He is not condemning me” . She receives a gift of forgiveness when she deserves to die, Romans 6:23, “For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal live in Christ Jesus our Lord”. She receives the gift of eternal life after being accused of sinning. The rest who left, went back in their sins and the man who she was caught with in adultery remained in sin. In the minds of the accusers, they made a mistake when they brought her to Jesus. Alone in His presence, vulnerable and helpless gave the Master a chance to cleanse her and set her free. When the law has chased you to the cross and left you helpless, that is when Jesus steps in with mercy and grace. Three things she received that day, mercy, a promise and commission. When she was brought, Jesus showed her mercy by not saying okay to the people to stone her. He also gave her a promise, “neither do I condemn you” then He commissioned her, “Go and sin no more”.

Who is like Jesus, we mess up big time and yet He is still calling us and telling us in 1John 1:9, “If we confess our sins, He is faithful and just to forgive us of our sins and cleanse us from all unrighteousness”. Why are many harboring sin and holding on to it? is it because they don’t think that they can be forgiven? Many have made promises that they will not go back to do the same things but sooner or later, they found themselves in it again. And because of that, they don’t believe that they can be forgiven and be free. Guilt is killing you for your conscience is accusing you and you are being convicted, it’s time to make things right with God. David in talking to God said in, Psalm 51:16, “You do not desire sacrifice, or else I would give it; You do not delight in burnt offering. vs. 17, “The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit, a broken and contrite (deeply sorry, remorseful, repentant) heart”. Just as this woman could not bring sacrifices, she had a broken and contrite heart and with that she received what she wasn’t expecting. I pray that we will never take the sin issue lightly for God hates sin. He’s love is demonstrated in His justice therefore God must punish sin. Check where you have glossed over sin, and let the Holy Ghost conviction arrest you and bring you to His presence that you might repent of it.

One last thing, when the woman was forgiven, she must have walked boldly on the streets again, more free, rejoicing and the like. No one could condemn her anymore for something she did was now a history. Romans 8:1, “There is therefore now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus, who do not walk according to the flesh, but according to the Spirit”. Was condemned, not any more for I am forgiven. I did not earn or worked for it, but He freely gave it to me. Romans 4:7, “blessed are they whose sins are forgiven, and those whose sins are covered!!!!. I was once condemned but now I am forgiven how about you? Blessings Ev

title.rendered: Condemned Yet Forgiven, Part 1, by Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 8:1-11, “…And Jesus said to her, “Neither do I condemn you; go and sin no more”

This term commonly used, “I’m not perfect” reminds us that regardless of who we are, we have some flaws in our lives. We have defects, blemish, imperfections, errors and all these things mentioned have shattered our perfection leaving us as guilty sinners before a holy God. We say things we should not, do things we should not, neglect things we should do. We shatter God’s law and sometimes gloss over the seriousness of it to the extent of trying to cover when it’s hard to deal with it. What is wrong with a little bit of lust here and there?, what is the big deal if I say something to someone and I am okay with it even if they are not? Our imperfection leads us to want to be forgiven but there can be not forgiveness without repentance.

Jesus was teaching on mount Olives very early one morning, before long the Scribes and the Pharisees brought to Him a woman caught in adultery. And when they had set her in His presence “they said to Him, “Teacher, this woman was caught in adultery, in the very act”, John 8:4. I’m amazed for number one, one woman brought to Jesus by many people. Second, they say that she was caught in the very act. If she was caught in the act and we know that adultery is a participation of at least two, my question is, where was the man??? They concentrated on what the woman did but nobody was mentioning the man she was caught with. She had been accused, her conscious told her that she was wrong and deserved to be stoned to death. She had been ashamed before everyone else, she had been stripped of her dignity and there was nothing she could do to get out of it. Our guilty state strips us of the same things because our conscious accuses us and the accuser of brethren never ceases to fuel our guilt before God. And with all the accusations, we are left helpless. DL Moody said, “The law can only chase a person to the cross, not any further”. The law does not help us, it leaves us guilty and helpless.

John 8:5, “Now Moses, in the law, commanded us that such should be stoned. But what do You say?, vs. 6, This they said testing Him, that they have something of which to accuse Him”. These people were not concerned about justice otherwise they would have brought the man too, they had an agenda and therefore they used this woman as a bait. They knew what the law said, but they were more concerned about how it affected someone else and not them. It can be very easy to look at someone’s flaws and neglect yours and it could be backed up by this thought, “Mine is not as bad as theirs”. Before God a law broken is the same regardless of its magnitude. An example, if you have a perfect jar and you drop it, even if the crack on it is very small, you have shattered it’s perfection. James 2:10, “For whosoever shall keep the whole law and yet offend it at one point is guilty of all”. You break one, you’ve broken them all. The way you look at it does not matter, the fact remains that you and I have shattered the perfection of that jar and ought to be punished. John 8:6, “…But Jesus stooped down and wrote on the ground with His finger, as though He did not hear”. Could it be possible that the reason why Jesus decided to be quiet was to give the scribes and the Pharisees an opportunity to examine themselves and see if they had not broken the law themselves?. They were too quick to judge without first examining themselves, so without wasting any more time, they asked Him again John 8:8, and He said to them, “He who is without sin among you, let him throw a stone at her first”. Tough question to deal with but the ball is rolled back to their court. You came to accuse but now you are being convicted of your own flaws for you know that you too have shattered the laws of God. “But Lord it’s not about me but about someone else I brought before You. I came to pray about them not necessarily for them. I did not even come to ask You to forgive them, I wanted them condemned”. By one woman’s act, not only is she convicted of her sins, but through her many are also convicted who saw themselves good and clean in the sight of God.

What do I do when I am convicted and I deserve to be stoned to death, I could deny but the Holy Ghost caught me sinning. I cannot lie because that would mean breaking another law. I have enough flaws and yet I also have accusers on my case, I cannot justify myself for three words come in mind, guilty, guilty, guilty. I am Condemned!!!!!, to finish, blessings Ev

title.rendered: Prayer And Learning In Death Valley, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

I cry aloud to the LORD; I lift up my voice to the LORD for mercy. I pour out my complaint before him; before him I tell my trouble. When my spirit grows faint within me, it is you who know my way. In the path where I walk men have hidden a snare for me. Look to my right and see; no one is concerned for me. I have no refuge; no one cares for my life. I cry to you, O LORD; I say, “You are my refuge, my portion in the land of the living.” Listen to my cry, for I am in desperate need; rescue me from those who pursue me, for they are too strong for me. Set me free from my prison, that I may praise your name. Then the righteous will gather about me because of your goodness to me. (Psalm 142)

Here is David, alone, tired, exhausted, confused, on the run and alone in a cave (before the 400 men gathered to him). He had taken his food from the fields, slept in trees, hid in ditches, and crawled through mud as he ran. For days he ran. Here he was filthy, and lonely. Perhaps the mothers had told their children that they should behave or else they would end up like the town drunk. Now kids were being told to be good or else they would end up like the giant killer, David. David was misunderstood by others. This cave was now his castle.

I. Lament (heart cry) of the individual (verses 1 -2). David unreservedly cries out with full emotion ALOUD to the Lord. Hey if people can scream over their sport’s team we should be able to cry out LOUD to our King. He called out for mercy which is not getting what we do deserve. I deserved Hell because I broke God’s Law, but I didn’t get Hell, I got Heaven instead, thank God! He pours out his complaint to the Lord, not just simply throwing up a whimsical prayer. His spirit was growing faint (beyond tiredness). These phrases illustrate the tension between anguish of soul and dependence on the Lord. Have you ever felt so broken and cried out to the Lord? This is the prayer of a broken man.

II. Loneliness in Suffering (142:3-7a) My spirit grows faint. His adversary and his prayers had brought David to the place of total exhaustion. He shares that it is the Lord alone that knows his way (life). He shares that men have hidden a snare for me, people were after David for no good reason! No one is concerned for me, no one cares about my life he thought. I have no refuge, there are no places of rest for me. No one cared for my life, I am all alone in this thing. He feels even the Lord is not at his “right” hand. The “right” signifies the place where one’s witness or legal counsel stood. He had no one to defend him against his adversaries, and his words could not penetrate the hatred in Saul’s heart toward him. He says of the Lord “You are my refuge, my portion in the land of the living.” God became his refuge, his safe haven, his only protection. Only the Lord could rescue David at this point. This is the prayer of a desperate man.

IV. Public Thanksgiving (142:7b) David moves from despair to thanksgiving believing this feels like the end, but it’s not over for me. I am not going to stay in this cave of “Death Valley” I will have the righteous community to crowd around me and listen to my thanksgiving for the great acts of God’s deliverance. This is the prayer of a broken, desperate man that can hope in the Lord and have his heart brought to a place of thanksgiving.

Application: Will you turn away from God or to God during you lowest times. Will you move from despair to thanks no matter how alone and broken you are? Can you hope in the Lord as your refuge, and give up and decide to live in “Death Valley?!?!”. Blessings Pastor Phil

title.rendered: After you have suffered a little while.. by Sis. Bala Samson

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1 Peter 5:10 And the God of all grace, who called you to His eternal glory in Christ, after you have suffered a little while, will Himself restore you and make you strong, firm and steadfast.
God sometimes speaks loudly through His Word, I was excited as I read this scripture which refreshed and revitalized me . We should remember that the trials the devil seeks to use to destroy us, God desires to use, to make us stronger and more equipped to follow Him. Every tree that produces fruit, He prunes so as to make it stronger. (John 15:2) Suffering wasn’t a sign that they were doing something wrong, but Peter reminds us that through the sufferings, God strengthens us spiritually. Satan may try to tear us down through failures, discouragements and humiliation, but God builds you in the midst of all the pain. Want to know more? Stay tuned!

As I look back into my life, the most humiliating moments have been the ones which helped to break me and mold me. We need some breaking in order to be blessed. Too many successes makes us haughty and proud; when God steps in, He loves to cut that off. Remember, Moses was handsome, when he was born but God had to put him 40 years in the wilderness and then make use of him. Never get proud of your height, color, personality and intelligence or whatever; God can spot that subtle ego buried inside you and He would deal with it severely. God has a way to look deep into our sins. We may think it “small” and insignificant but it is “big sin” for God. Understand? Once while on the stage I suddenly lost the Presence of God near me, I felt lost and scared. I was screaming on the inside for God to give me the anointing back, but He allowed me to suffer on the stage. After the meeting, I fasted and prayed seeking for an answer. God showed certain things which might be petty for me but pretty big deal for Him and He was dealing with me to crucify me and make me fruitful. I can suffer anything in this world but not the pain of losing His anointing, I still shiver at the thought of being left stranded without the anointing!

These words, “after you have suffered a little while”, catches our attention, is it not? While waiting on God, seeking the face and advice of my God, he dropped this word into my spirit – it will only hurt for a little while! Friend, since I am a mother of two children, I can surely explain this better to you this morning. When my children come home hurt and bruised, I would take the first aid box with antiseptics, soap, water, sponge, and bandages in it. My kids would look at my face pathetically and I would lovingly tell them, “If we don’t clean it, it will get infected, and besides it will only hurt for a little while.” When the antiseptic is applied it burns, but it heals. Sometimes children insist on just putting a band-aid on the infected place which would result in the wound getting septic.

God is trying to pour on the antiseptic on our wounds, hurts, and pains. It is only to eventually heal you. The subtle pride that is buried in you, the infection of laziness, rebellion, disobedience, self-righteousness everything would go. God knows everything about us. Sometimes we need ‘deep treatment’ for cleansing, but once He touches us, He brings about a marvelous change. The ‘treatment’ that God gives us may be in the form of illness, financial loss, job loss, misunderstandings in relationships, rebellious children and so on. Only when it hurts us do we understand the hurt that we had done to others, which stirs us to repent and change. When God pours that antiseptic into your wound you will be reminded of your ill spoken word and you will have to go and ask that person to forgive you. Observe the above scripture closely, it says, ‘He will Himself restore you.’ Comforting is it not? He will never leave you to be burnt, but through the trial period, God makes us strong, firm and steady. Blessings, devotion by Sis. Bala Samson

title.rendered: To The Uttermost, By Bro. Ben

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Hebrews 7:25- Therefore He is able to save to the uttermost those who come to God through Him, since He always lives to make intercession for them.

Hallelujah, what a savior! Able to save to the uttermost, the precious blood of Jesus, which washes the vilest of sinners white as snow. No pope, no church, no man can do this, only Jesus. It is not accomplished through good works, reading a Bible, baptism, church membership, education and vain knowledge, nothing but abiding faith in the precious blood of the spotless Lamb of God. He is able, and He is willing, if any will come to Him, He will save them, and as they lay their life down in utter abandonment of sin and self, He will save to the uttermost, to the highest degree. The word uttermost means completely, perfectly, utterly. It points to a complete salvation from all sin, a cleansing of the very nature of men and women, not just a washing, a cleansing from all unrighteousness. He is able, by the blood of His cross, through faith, to save us completely, to sanctify us wholly, to literally make us holy, and keep us holy. No longer wavering, no longer going in and out of sin, no more of the inconsistent “Christian” life. There is no such things as a sinning religion, it doesn’t exist in the New Testament. Christ died for a glorious bride, without spot or wrinkle, holy and without blemish( Ephesians 5:26-27).

He is able, if we will come to Him by faith. If we will surrender our lives to Him, He is able to cleanse us to the uttermost, unto perfection, to sanctify us in an instantaneous moment, to make us holy, not after years and years of growth, no NOW! In a moment, if we will come to God by faith, through Jesus Christ, who even now intercedes for each one. I John tells us that He was manifested to “take away our sins,” and “that He might destroy the works of the devil.” (I John 3:5,8) Both these verses point to the utter destruction of our sin, the removal of it from our lives and hearts. This is full salvation, the complete work of the cross, preparing each believer for glorious unhindered growth in Christ, the removal of the weeds in a garden will bring rapid fruitful growth, so the removal of sin will bring fruitful Christian growth. This is the power of the gospel, the purifying of each truly born again believer’s heart by unwavering faith in Christ, and the merits of His cross.

I Corinthians 15:57- But thanks be to God, who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ. Is Jesus Lord of your life? Is he really? Then God gives you the victory this day, through Him, that we may live righteous holy lives for the glory of God, proclaiming His truth to a dying world. There is a further work friends, to all who desire it. The Lord whom you seek will suddenly come to His temple(Malachi 3:1), He will burn up all the chaff, he will baptize you in the Holy Spirit and with fire(Matthew 3:11-12). Will you come to Him by faith? Will you give Him all He asks? Will you take Him at His word? Will you lay your life down today? Right now? As you read this? Jesus stands ready and willing, He knocks, will we open? Romans 12:1- I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the mercies of God, that you present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable to God, which is your reasonable service.

In the victorious name of Jesus, and all for His eternal glory, Brother Ben

title.rendered: Lord Establish The Unexpected, by Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

Hebrews 10:9, “then He said, “Behold, I have come to do Your will, O God.” He takes away the first that He may establish the second”

It amazes how God does not do things according to the way we think. He always takes a different turn and just when you think you have figured Him out, He does something that blows your mind and you are back to seeking to know more. Over and over again I see God raising the unexpected, the one that the blessing was not secured for by man’s standards, is the one He raises. When You look at Cain and Abel, the blessing rests on Abel, looking at Esau and Jacob, the blessing rests on Jacob, the prodigal son and his older brother, the blessing rests on the unexpected. Abel, Jacob, and the prodigal son have one thing in common, they are second born and no one ever expected them to be blessed Why is this important? simple, God is in the business of raising the second (the unexpected).

The first tends to be stubborn and unwilling to humble himself or bend therefore God always bypasses the first to establish the second. God bypassed Adam the first man created to send Jesus His Only begotten Son, the second Adam. What Adam messed up, Jesus came to fix it. Jesus came to undo what Adam did.

Hebrews 10:9, the theme verse of my life starts by saying, “He said, “Behold, I have come to do Your will”, Jesus came to do the will of the Father, the mark of obedience in the second. For God to build the second, the layer of the first has to come out that the tender heart of the second may be established. While the first may desire to do things his own way, the second is seeking ways to do the will of the Father. In the world we were like the first stubborn born and God had to bypass all that to bring out the inner child inside of us that accepts Him by faith. Mark 10:15, “Assuredly, I say to you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God as a little child will by no means enter it.” It’s not the sophisticated, all knowing and looking able that He raises, He raises the weak, the one who feels he is unable but yet available.

The word “establish” means to bring about, to place or settle. What’s God word saying to us “He takes away the first that He may establish the second”. Are you glad that He has called you in spite of your weaknesses, failures, insecurities to establish you simply because you were willing to do His will? He bypassed everything you knew about yourself to build the inner child kind of faith you never knew you had. What you placed second in your life is what He has come to establish. What you never thought He could use is what He is establishing. Our prayer today, Lord establish in our lives what we placed second, insignificant and unexpected. Bypass our pride, arrogance, stubborn and establish our faith, hope, confidence and humility that will also concur the first. As you establish us, establish all that you have brought in our lives. Establish our finances, marriages, children, jobs, ministries etc. as we yield Your will. By passing the first to establish the second, the unexpected is a very humbling experience. blessings Ev

title.rendered: Separate Yourselves, by Bro Ben

content.rendered:
Good morning, II Corinthians 6:17- ” Therefore, ‘Come out from among them And be separate, says the Lord. Do not touch what is unclean, And I will receive you.” Paul here, quoting from Numbers 33:51-56, ousts the idea of the possibility of a lukewarm, sinning, carnal Christianity. Through the words of the Lord God Jehovah, he brings out further the need for holiness, and a total separation from the world. Hebrews 12:14 tells us that without holiness, no one shall even see the Lord, as Paul says here, it is our abstaining from all uncleanness, our holy hearts and lives, that cause God to receive us as His children, for we are to resemble Him in every aspect of our lives
As separation from worldly things and self-denial in the pursuit of holiness brings us closer to God, received as His own as we bear more and more His image, so the presence of willful sin and a disobedient, neglectful lifestyle will remove us from God’s presence, for He will not dwell with the unclean things, for He is perfectly holy and pure. We can say we are a Christian, but in reality, our sin has grieved away the Holy Spirit, and we stand as a vacated house, a fruitless tree to be cast into the fire. We must come to God, to the foot of the cross, and there leave our lives, forsaking all else to buy and keep this pearl of great price. Our Savior did not die to do us a favor, He died to save and cleanse us from all sin, to gloriously sanctify us in this life by His further workings of grace within, making us holy as He is holy, living in present victory over sin, making us fit to be citizens of the Heavenly city prepared, and holy vessels in this life that He may fill and use for His glory
Be not mistaken, sin separates us from God, it brings in condemnation and will negate our salvation. Hebrews 10:38 tells us that the just shall live by faith; But if anyone draws back, My soul has no pleasure in Him. To live by faith is to be living in present, active obedience to God, this is how the Greek defines this word in scripture. If we draw back to sin, back to the old ways, God has no pleasure in us. He calls for holiness, and Praise His Name, He gives us His grace, not to cover our sin, but to enable each of us by faith to overcome sin! So let us come this day, boldly to the throne of grace, truly offering our lives to Him, crucifying our will and our lives, that Jesus may truly live in us, filling and flooding our lives and hearts with His divine glory. If you will hear His voice, hearden not your hearts
Yours in the service of our King, blessings Brother Ben

title.rendered: Are You Known For Virtue, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,
Ruth 3:8 reads, “In the middle of the night something startled the man, and he turned and discovered a woman lying at his feet.” And now, my daughter, don’t be afraid. I will do for you all you ask. All my fellow townsmen know that you are a virtuous women. Ruth 3:8,11
Boaz, who the Scriptures says was a relative of Naomi’s on her husband’s side, from the clan of Elimelech, was a man of wealth spoke these powerful, encouraging and defining words of the life of this one women named Ruth. Ruth had been told by Naomi to wash and put on her best clothes although it is unlikely that an impoverished Ruth would have had best clothes; the Hebrew [word] means only a “garment.” Her outer clothing was not defined by wealth by any means. This is going to be an important issue which we will see in a moment.
After instructing her not to fear, what did he focus on about Ruth? He focused on her character, her reputation. He said for all my fellow townsmen know that you are a virtuous women. How did everyone know this about her? This was quite a reputation to hold. Not just a few people close to Ruth had this testimony of her, but all in the town. Now we don’t know how many lived in the town of Bethlehem at that time, but we do know that her character NOT her clothing called attention to her. Why is that important? This is important to know because her character represented her heart while her clothing represented her outer appearance.
Remember when God was approving of David and disapproving of Saul. 1 Sam 16:7 reads, “But the LORD said to Samuel, “Do not consider his appearance or his height, for I have rejected him. The LORD does not look at the things man looks at. Man looks at the outward appearance, but the LORD looks at the heart.” (1 Sam 16:7) We as human beings are easily impressed–and therefore often deceived–by what our eyes tell us, while God looks at the “heart.” God sees everything within us. Ruth would surely have answered the question that Proverbs 31:10 poses when it asks, “A wife of virtue who can find? She is worth far more than rubies.” A beautiful woman by (her outward appearance) is easy to find. But a virtuous women is worth, is priced, or valued FAR MORE THAN RUBIES. The more rare a stone is the more precious it becomes. A woman of such high caliber is worth FAR MORE than any precious stone, diamond, gold, silver. Paul mentions in 1 Cor. 3:11 “If any man builds on this foundation using gold, silver, costly stones…, since valuable metals and precious stones were used to adorn ancient temples (Rev 21:18-21), to portray that a life built with Christ as the foundation is like a life built by things that matter and are costly. Ruth’s life was built by things that really mattered, godly character, and everyone saw that godliness in her. The outer shell will fade away with age. Everything on a woman that perhaps is firm right now, will sag and become wrinkled one day. If all a woman possess was her outer beauty when that is gone, what will she have left?
It is believed that Ruth was in fact a beautiful women outwardly as Ruth 2:5 tells us,” Boaz asked the foreman of his harvesters, “Whose young woman is that?,” suggesting a beauty and an attraction toward her. But in the end when they married yes her outward beauty played a part, but it is her inner beauty that kept this man desiring to marry her. (Ruth 4:13). Ruth would become mother to Obed, father of Jesse, father of David. Wow, what a godly heritage!
Application: Perhaps you know some women of such character, but are they know by so many for their character. If you are a woman, yes, keep your beauty outwardly, but let God develop that inward beauty or keep that inward beauty if it is already present in you. When you stand before the Lord, the outward shell that caused the eyes of the opposite sex to start will be gone, and only your character will stand before God. Blessings Pastor Phil

title.rendered: We Are At War, Part 2, by Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,
Eph 6:10-18, “…Put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil…”
We looked at how the enemy always gives us the wrong impressions on who to fight. We therefore need to learn how we prepare with the tools and the right clothing.
I face the enemy every single second of the minute of the hour of the days of the months of the year. Sometimes he might just leave me for a season for he is bound to come back. I need to be ready at all times and so should you.
Paul in concluding his letter to the church at Ephesus had some wisdom to share with them. He knew of the things that they were facing and would continue to face. He begins to conclude his letter by saying, “Finally my brethren, be strong in the Lord and in the power of His might”. This is the introduction to the fight, be strong not in oneself but in the Lord, the overcomer. James 4:7, Submit yourselves therefore to God, resist the devil and he will flee”, You cannot resist the devil without first submitting to God. Its in submitting to God that He gives you the strength and grace to resist and that’s how Paul put it in the next sentence in the same verse “…Put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to stand against the wiles (tricks) of the devil.
“For we wrestle not against flesh and blood but against principalities, against powers, against the rulers of darkness of this world, against the spiritual wickedness high places”. We are not fighting some small enemies, we are fighting big ones and so twice we hear Paul mentioning the act of putting on the whole armor of God. Putting the armor of God is like putting on the combat attire ready for anything that might come as we do not know how big or small they will come.
Knowing all that we know about what we are going to be facing, we enter into our closets and prepare. . Vs 14, “Stand therefore, having girded your waist with truth”, the devil is the father of lies, you better put on truth, gird yourself with God’s word at all times. “Having put on the breastplate of righteousness”, it’s a round the chest where the breastplate is placed and as you can see that this is the area where the heart is and being that God deals with the heart first, when the heart is right with God, the entire being will be changed. “Having shod your feet with the preparation of the gospel of peace;” In Isaiah 52:7, “How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of Him who brings good news”. The good news does bring peace in ones life, you also overcome when you lead others to find eternal life. Vs 16, Above all, taking the shield of faith with which you will be able to quench all the fiery darts of the wicked one”, It’s easy to be wounded if you do not have a shield and here we are told that our shield is the most important thing that we should always have as that we keep us from falling. Heb 11:16, “Without faith, it is impossible to please Him”, “vs 17, Don’t forget to put on the helmet of salvation”, I’ve seen this even with major dangerous sports, they always put on the helmet to protect them from any brain damage if anything ever happens to them. Every believer also has to put on the helmet of salvation as that will protect us in the days when we fall. vs 17, ” and the word of the Spirit, which is the word of God. This is important too as this is your only offensive weapon as the rest are defensive weapons. We have to know the word and this could mean memorizing the word and knowing where it is and so that when the enemy begins to fight, we are well equipped. Heb 4:12, The word of the Lord is living and powerful, sharper than any double edged sword…”. Remember the enemy knows the word too and so he will come to us the same way he came to Jesus in the wilderness and say “It’s written”, We also need stand with the written word. Paul concludes by telling the Ephesians to pray always will all prayer and supplication in the Spirit, and being watchful to this end with all perseverance and supplication for all the saints. We need to watch and be ready at all times for, Prayer assists in testing, prepping your tools. Rom 5:8, “Be sober, be vigilant cause your adversary the devil like a roaring lion walketh about seeking souls that he may devour. Take note of how the bible puts it “Like a roaring lion”, he is not the lion as Jesus is the Lion of the Tribe of Judah. We are all soldiers in the army of God, we will fight till the end, choose this day and always to put on your defensive weapons and pick up your offensive weapons to fight back. No retreat no surrender. Blessings Ev

title.rendered: We Are At War, Part 1, by Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,
2Cor 10:3-5, “For though we walk in the flesh, we do not war according to the flesh…”
It’s vital for Christians to know who they are in Christ and their position in the Kingdom. It’s good to know exactly where you fit in as a player in the game. In major sports there are different positions and every player knows their position in the field. I’m not good at sports so I can’t tell what positions are there but one thing I know is that there are defense and offense in different sports. The Kingdom of God also has defense and offense structure. Before salvation, “…we were enemies of God through wicked works” Colossians 1:21 for we played or served the devil, and ourselves at salvation, we made peace with God Romans 5:1. We are now on the Lord’s side.
If then we be in Christ, we are recruited in the heavenliess Army. We are soldiers in the Kingdom and God is the commander in chief of the armed forces. He is the Mighty Warrior; He is the Lion of the tribe of Judah. Whenever one is in the army, there is an enemy that he or she has to face because there is no way you can be in the war ground and be liked on both sides. One side would hate you and you have to be aware of the fact that you have to be ready at all times you could be called upon. Every believer is at war whether they want to accept it or not. We fight daily because we are constantly under attack. It’s good to fight but you need to know who your enemy is.
Many Christians fight the wrong enemy as, the bible in 2Cor 10:3, “For though we walk in the flesh, we do not war according to the flesh…”. The moment you read and understand this verse, is when you will cease to fight your spouse, your children, your neighbor, your workmates, etc. It’s not a physical battle. People have always been used as a means to accomplish the devils’ dirty tricks. We have had friends who have hurt us, jobs that frustrated us, family members that have discouraged us, situations that have brought pain and frustrations to us, you name it. All these things have one thing in common and the common denominator is that an enemy is behind it. You will also realize that something the Lord could be using to build our faith and teach us endurance, the enemy will try to cease the moment to abort.
Vs. 4&5, “For the weapons of our warfare are not carnal but mighty through God to the pulling down of strong holds, casting down imaginations and every high thing that exalt itself against the knowledge of God and bringing every thought into captivity under the obedience of Christ”. Every soldier recruited is given weapons to fight, you cannot be in the army and have nothing or else you will be killed even before you go far. God has given us weapons both offensive and defensive. 2Cor 10:3-5 come in handy when we talk about what we’ve been equipped with.
What I am trying to say guys is that we constantly have an enemy and the enemy is not that person or that situation you are thinking of. If you are not facing any challenges and everything is always going on well with you, no tough times to face sometimes, check again and see on whose side are you leaning on. Begin to fight your enemies on your knees. Matthew 11:12, “And from the days of John the Baptist until now, the Kingdom of God suffers violence and the violent take it by force” to continue, blessings Ev

title.rendered: Planted By The River, by Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,
Psalm 1:2&3, “But his delight is in the law of Lord, And in his law he meditates day and night. He shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water, That brings forth its fruit in its season, whose leaf also shall not wither; And whatever he does shall prosper”
There is something about the law of God that puts us in check. It’s not burdensome or away to put us down, we delight in it. There are three groups of people, 1. people who accommodate the law; 2. Those who hypocritically live under it; 3. Those who love it (His truth). We should be in the third group. It’s the law that opens our eyes to distinguish between right and wrong and it’s the law that shows us how much we need God. A little girl looked at a sheep and thought how white and wonderful that sheep looked then it began to snow. At that point the sheep did not look white anymore because the snow was much whiter and cleaner than the sheep and the girl thought how dirty the sheep looked. Did the sheep change? no it just appeared in a different back ground and so are we when we look at the standards of men, we look clean but when the snow of God’s righteousness falls, we all see our short falls and we turn to Him. We don’t have the law (truth) to condemn us, we have the law to guide us and convict us that we may in turn work towards perfection which is of God. I always do spiritual check to see whether I am heading towards the right direction. Before people point that I am going the wrong way, I want to be the first one to be convicted of it and so I delight myself in His law, meditating upon it day and night, thinking about the Lord, reading His word to guide me as I strive to please Him. If I can just please the Lord, that is all that matters. Delight in the law of Lord, And meditate on it day and night.
He shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water,. It’s in the meditating we become like a tree planted by the rivers of water, the sustenance of our life. We need water to be refreshed and cleansed. We need water to quench our thirst we need it for growth., Our existence depends on our dependence on God, “without His help, we are doomed to fail”. Meditate on His law that it may show you how you need Him and then be like a tree planted by His river for growth in Him.
That brings forth its fruit in its season, whose leaf also shall not wither. We all have seasons and our seasons depend on what we are into and what we are connected to. The Psalmist tells us that our fruit is a result of where we are planted. Anyone who plants, has an aim reap. They desire to see the fruit of their labor and so daily they watch and hope that the time will come for them to reap the harvest. I cannot plant today and hope to harvest tomorrow, there is a season for harvest and by us being planted by the river, we are watching and hoping that in due time, in our season we will bear the fruit. Your season may not be my season, your season of encouragement could be my season of discouragement but I know for sure that my time will come. Don’t be frustrated that someone else is enjoying their season, do all you need to do in your season and expect fruit in your own season. The bible says that this TOO SHALL PASS, seasons of depression, brokenness, fear, lack, will all pass. Not only do we bring fruit in our seasons, our leaf will not wither and what a blessing that is for people to look at you and say, “YOU ARE BLESSED”
And whatever he does shall prosper, God does give us instructions and tells us the end result when we do what He requires of us. In this case if we will meditate upon the law, be planted by the river, bring fruit in season and our leaf does not wither, whatever we do shall prosper. Being attached to a blessed river causes one to be blessed and everything he or she touches becomes blessed, your work will be blessed, your home, you family will be blessed I mean everything you do will just prosper and the word prosper I would say is a sign of abundance.
Proverbs 10:32, “The lips of the righteous knows what is acceptable…”, You and I know what is acceptable and what is required of us, let us be doers of the word not just hearers only deceiving ourselves. Who doesn’t want to be blessed? Blessings Ev

title.rendered: Be Careful Who You Take Counsel From, By Pastor Phil

content.rendered:
Good morning,

1Kings 12:6-16, ” Then King Rehoboam consulted the elders who had served his father Solomon during his lifetime. “How would you advise me to answer these people?” he asked. 7 They replied, “If today you will be a servant to these people and serve them and give them a favorable answer, they will always be your servants.”  8 But Rehoboam rejected the advice the elders gave him and consulted the young men who had grown up with him and were serving him. 9 He asked them, “What is your advice? How should we answer these people who say to me, `Lighten the yoke your father put on us’?”  10 The young men who had grown up with him replied, “Tell these people who have said to you, `Your father put a heavy yoke on us, but make our yoke lighter’–tell them, `My little finger is thicker than my father’s waist. 11 My father laid on you a heavy yoke; I will make it even heavier. My father scourged you with whips; I will scourge you with scorpions.’ ”   12 Three days later Jeroboam and all the people returned to Rehoboam, as the king had said, “Come back to me in three days.” 13 The king answered the people harshly. Rejecting the advice given him by the elders, 14 he followed the advice of the young men and said, “My father made your yoke heavy; I will make it even heavier. My father scourged you with whips; I will scourge you with scorpions.” 15 So the king did not listen to the people, for this turn of events was from the LORD, to fulfill the word the LORD had spoken to Jeroboam son of Nebat through Ahijah the Shilonite.  16 When all Israel saw that the king refused to listen to them, they answered the king: “What share do we have in David, what part in Jesse’s son?  To your tents, O Israel!  Look after your own house, O David!”  So the Israelites went home.”

Who do you seek advice from?  It’s interesting to note that Rehoboam went to two groups of people for advice, the elders (older men) and the young men (his contemporaries).  The elders told him what he needed to hear, while the young men told him what he wanted to hear.  The elders told him to grant the request of Israel, while the young men told him to lay the heavy yoke on Israel, over and above what Solomon laid upon them.  Even though ultimately this was the Sovereign will of God, just like Judas the betrayer, we should be careful who we take counsel from. Each of us needs advice at times, but who do you turn to?  I often advise teens not to go to other teens to help them with their problems for the most part, because their friends are going through the same things, but rather to those that are older who have gone through many of the issues that they face, just with “different clothing” if you will. So I ask who is your “advisory committee”?  Do you have people close to you that can provide godly counsel to you?  I have often heard it said you should always have a Paul who builds into you (an inlet), a Timothy that you are building into (an outlet), and a Barnabas to encourage you along the way.  Do you have these three kinds of people in your life? The wisdom you are given from your Paul, will be passed on to your Timothy and encouraged by your Barnabas.

Application:  Do you have faithful “counselors?”  Are you hearing from those who tell you what you want to hear or what you need to hear?  Who is your Paul, Timothy, and Barnabas? Blessings, Pastor Phil

title.rendered: A True Worshiper Of God, Part 2, by Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 4:20-26, “22 You worship what you do not know; we know what we worship, for salvation is of the Jews. 23 But the hour is coming, and now is, when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth; for the Father is seeking such to worship Him. 24 God is Spirit, and those who worship, Him must worship in spirit and truth.”

Samaritans were worshipers as Jesus mentions,  the only problem  they did not know who they worshiped. And I am convinced in our churches today, many people come to worship the God they know not. They may know about Him, but they have little or no understanding of who He is for they have not studied His word to know Him. How can we worship the true God and still believe there are many ways to God, or believe in evolution, or believe abortion or homosexuality is okay, or embrace gambling among other things that are contrary to who God is as revealed in His word?. Yes some people struggle in dealing and accepting them, which is different from someone who has acknowledged and given their seal of approval that they are ok. True worshipers know who their God is and what He requires of us.

We see Paul encountering with Jews and Gentiles in Athens (Acts 17:16- ), people who were very religious, who were worshipers of idols and unknown gods. Yes they worshiped, but they did not worship the true God for He had not been introduced to them. They had zeal without knowledge. He says to them “vs. 22…Men of Athens, I perceive that in all things you are very religious; 23 for as I was passing through and considering the objects of your worship, I even found an altar with this inscription: TO THE UNKNOWN GOD. Therefore, the One whom you worship without knowing, Him I proclaim to you:” Acts 17:22-23.

This is where true worshipers of God the Father must worship in spirit and truth. These two go hand in hand; here the spirit does not mean Holy Spirit but human spirit, a willing heart. A willing heart must be accompanied by truth for true worship to occur. God has magnified His word above His name, I believe the reason is simple, that believers may learn the truth and turn their worship to Him in spirit and truth. This is why I love the preaching of the word, it exalts Christ and therefore worship the God of the Bible, rather than the god in my making or the god, I am comfortable with. Heaven and earth shall pass away, but the divine word will not pass away, and in this respect, especially it has preeminence over every other form of manifestation.

“Preaching is not the end for those who are hearing, but the means to worship” Paul Washer. In Psalm 138:2 David says, “I will worship toward Your holy temple, And praise Your name For Your loving kindness and Your truth; For You have magnified Your word above all Your name”, The Lord had ordained a center of unity, a place of sacrifice, a house of His indwelling; and David accepted the way of worship enjoined by revelation of His word. Even so, the true hearted believer of these days must not fall into the will worship of superstition, or the wild worship of skepticism, but reverently worship as the Lord Himself prescribes in His word. The word is the means to an end where God is worshiped when Christ is exalted.

Jesus preached the truth to the woman at the well. He did not spare the woman of her sin, He told her of her adulteress life exposing sin her life that in repentance she would finally worship the Holy and Just God,. We see the same with Paul proclaiming (preaching) to the Athenians, who in turn they would worship the Father in spirit and truth. Let us therefore adore the Lord who has spoken to us by His word, and by His Son; and in the presence of unbelievers let us both praise His holy name and extol His holy word.  Blessings Ev

title.rendered: A True Worshiper Of God, Part 1, by Evans

content.rendered:
Good morning,

John 4:20-26, “22 You worship what you do not know; we know what we worship, for salvation is of the Jews. 23 But the hour is coming, and now is, when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth; for the Father is seeking such to worship Him. 24 God is Spirit, and those who worship Him must worship in spirit and truth.”

If you are like me, there are those times you sit and meditate on something profound you do or should do but never paid close attention to study it and go deeper as to why it’s done and how to explain it to others. I’ve been meditating on this for about a week now, what does it mean to be a worshipful person or be in a worship service. Not that I don’t know, the  better question I ask myself is, how can I articulate it to someone and make sense while I go deeper as I discover more of the mystery of worship.

I’m not sure the worship of God is defined in Scripture, I see what it means to worship but I fail to find the definition in the scripture. From what I read, I find that it is not confined to praise; broadly it may be regarded as the direct acknowledgement to God, of His nature, attributes, ways and claims, whether by the outgoing of the heart in praise and thanksgiving or by deed done in such acknowledgment. Worship goes with worthiness, ascribing to God’s greatness. True worship service is where Christ is exalted in and through us by the Spirit of God. To quote my pastor, Gregg Johnson, “By His Spirit…For His glory”

In John 4 Jesus spoke to the Samaritan woman at the well, teaching her among other things what true worship is. The required place, the geographical location had ceased to be of importance. Up to this point, the worship of God was associated with the temple, the tabernacle but Christ had come to do a new thing, He had come to make it clear what it meant to worship the true God. It was primarily the attitude of the people and how they met. The stress is not to be laid upon the place where we worship God, but upon the state of mind in which we worship Him. Here we see this woman say, “20, “Our fathers worshiped on this mountain, and you Jews say that in Jerusalem is the place where one ought to worship.”. It was not about where but how, it was also not about outward appearance and actions, but something deeper than that. Vs 21, “Jesus said to her, “Woman, believe Me, the hour is coming when you will neither on this mountain, nor in Jerusalem, worship the Father”

“As creatures, we worship the Father of all: as Christians, we worship the Father of our Lord Jesus. Now the change shall be, in the nature of the worship. Christians shall worship God, not in the ceremonial observances of the Mosaic institution, but in spiritual ordinances, consisting less in bodily exercise, and animated and invigorated more with divine power and energy. The way of worship which Christ has instituted is rational and intellectual, and refined from those external rites and ceremonies with which the Old-Testament worship was both clouded and clogged”, Matthew Henry.

My first point today in this devotion is to make it clear as Jesus did, it’s not where we worship that is important primarily (though it is important), it’s the attitude, the condition of the heart. It’s where in your heart, in your life Christ is exalted in and through you “by His Spirit…for His glory” above everything else in word, thought and deeds, to continue Blessings Ev
